story:
We appreciate your time. 

Thank you for taking a moment to check out our page, learn about who we are, whats threatening  our eco-systems and most importantly, how with your help , together WE CAN accomplish with the help of thousands of individuals like yourself . With a small secure and simple online contribution YOU CAN HELP  in a huge way. It's common knowledge that over the past decade, the very living beings, that through their selfless act of pollination, have provided humankind with over thirty percent of the global food supplies, are dying off at a more than alarming rate. Approximately 50% or more do not survive the year.  I'm referring to North American Honey Bees which scientists, biologists, and environmentalists agree the cause of this dramatic loss of organic life is from man kind himself.

A vision of simple action, solution, and community access.
Our vision at Hives Across The Americas is to provide the general public with an opportunity to be part of the solution. By reaching out to create a renewed private, public, and commercial interest in both this 10 year epidemic of life loss, as well as helping to reintroduce to both the public and private sectors, the lost art of personal Bee Keeping, and provide healthy low cost organic and pesticide free pollination services for commercial fields and crops across the Canadian Maritimes, and Northeastern United States to start. That is just the beginning. Our intention is to provide a Bee Ranch and Preserve, a sanctuary if you will, where, with mother natures assistance and the utilization of our own acreage and bee keeping experience, we will organically grow and cultivate healthy Queen bees and their colonies utilizing  Newfoundland Honey Bees, very probably the last vestige of healthy and pesticed free honey bees in North America. 

Reaching out to the public every way possible
Hives Across The Americas will be active as a grass roots organization reaching out to the public and commercial interaction by reaching out publicly through community enthusiasm organizations, youth groups, agriculture groups and communities, street fairs and expositions, as well as other civic venues, which will allow us to create public and commercial interest, education, and knowledge of this global epidemic and the opportunity of solution based actions. We want all ages of men and women, girls and boys, private and commercial to have the opportunity to enjoy and reap the benefits of these amazing and delicate creatures.

How we are going to "grow" bees ?
Our initial placement will include building up to approximately 700 home site bee hives within the Bee Preserve in which we will organically grow Queen Bees and their worker colonies. The expected population of bees in those hives will be approximately 20 to 30 thousand healthy, organically grown Newfoundland honey bees in each. We will also be reaching out and engaged with local farmers and growers to provide low cost organic hives to their fields and crops providing all services including maintenance, relocation and transportation of those hives as well. Our initial start on commercial hives will be a build up to approximately 1500 off site hives. 

Along with the physical placement, Hives Across The Americas will be taking advantage of any opportunity to re-stimulate public interest, not only in the crisis we are now seeing, but also in the personal hives or hobby of Bee Keeping in the private sector, not leaving out commercial interest and applications as well. We can begin that public campaign by reaching out to civic and commercial venues to bring forth presentations at schools, agriculture youth groups, civic organizations, enthusiast groups, street fairs and farmers markets, agriculture businesses as well as farms.  Our goal will be to cultivate a desire to learn and carry on interest in the amazing world of the bee and all that it does for us as humans on this planet.



Unlike the normal North American honey bee, The Newfoundland honey bee is the very base line and the healthiest and purest of honey bees anywhere on this planet, They are the apex of mother natures finest works. Unfortunately, Newfoundland's entire province has only 48 bee keepers, large and small. Scientists agree that the need to grow and stimulate the bee population globally is dire. As mentioned before, bees and other pollinators are a key in providing approximately 30% of our food sources. Without bees, human kind will slowly starve. Scientists and biologists have stated this repeatedly around the world.

Why is this happening, what is Colony Collapse Disorder?
Humankind's use of pesticides and chemicals, as well as the huge fields of corporate farming, have joined together in causing this disaster. Pesticides are used on plants  in early and late growth. Those same pesticides are then absorbed by the bee itself as well as carried back to the hive via the affected honey bee. Ultimately, the entire hive and colony are saturated with chemicals. Another factor is the Varroa mite which lives on the bee itself as well as in the hive. These very same chemicals have created a very high tolerance in these mites which makes them almost impossible to kill. The Varroa mite is causing devastation within these hives thus ever increasing the spread and rate of Colony Collapse Disorder. These infected hives and their entire colony, including the queen bee, generally will not make it through the winter when the bees themselves re-ingest these same chemicals the entire season, while hibernating in their hives

Who we are
First off, we are two guys no different than anyone else . My partner Aaron and I have been together for over ten years. Both before and during those ten plus years, we have developed a list of life and career experiences that we bring to the table including a life time of a strong appreciation for nature, a combined 12 years of hands on, daily bee keeping and harvesting, many, many years of organic and  commercial produce management, an organic background in food service,  years of face to face, as well as online business management and over 9 years of public speaking, and teaching motivational skills. These are just a few of the skill sets we will employ and utilize. Also a life time of working towards and accomplishing goals. We're just a couple of Eco-minded , goal-oriented, mother earth friendly guys who are in this for the long term, no matter what. We want to help.
What happens to the money contributed to "Hives Across the Americas" ?
All monies collected will go solely to the cost of start up which includes healthy Queens and colonies for each hive, materials, supplies, and transportation cost of those hives. At approx $40 US to build and populate each hive, we are looking at nearly $68,000 for the Bees and hives themselves. We will utilize our own private property to establish the Bee Ranch and Preserve. There will be no cost related to using our own property to launch or maintain this cause. Aaron and I will happily absorb any financial  responsibility regarding property use and cost. Ultimately the goal will be to find another location where the amount of hives can be increased, Eventually, the harvesting of bee products can take place and be sold creating a self-supporting Hives Across The Americas non-profit organization.  In the case our financial goal is not met we will work with amounts we do have and begin our vision on a smaller scale, in a famous line taken from a classic hollywood movie "If you built it they come".
 
Finally,Im only one person ,how can that make a difference ?
Crowd funding is a new venue, Pass on this page to friends and family. Help them become aware. . No matter how large or how small, I think the bees themselves, have shown us how important something as small as they are, makes a HUGE difference.  You can make a difference , Your contributions are everything, We have taken quite some time to develop "Perks" or levels of contributions you can make. Each Perk was carefully looked at and designed to THANK YOU both short and long term. Some perks will continue to arrive over a three year span. Specifically those perks containing raw organic honey. Please double check your shipping information when choosing your Perk . We want to be sure you are able to receive and enjoy your gifts on time and fresh, the way nature intended. Every contribution is gratefully and humbly appreciated.
                                Jimi D and Aaron  B 
                                        co-founders

story:
Short Summary

  •  My name is Mark Plummer, Managing Director of Seismec. I pledge that my company will donate 10% of all funds raised at the end of this campaign to Sea Shepherd Australia. In addition I pledge that 20% of my companies future net annual profit will be donated to Sea Shepherd Australia www.seashepherd.org.au  for a minimum of 10 years from start up.  I have been in the Marine market for 26 years of which 18 years were spent offshore. I have worked in every Ocean around the World.
  • SEISMEC aim to purchase four Ships. These Ships will be put to work as Support and Standby Ships. Some of the work we will be involved in is scouting for Whales, Dolphins and Turtles during Seismic Surveys as per the Australian Government Department of Environment requirements, see link http://www.environment.gov.au/topics/marine/marine-species/cetaceans/industry  20% of SEISMEC`s net revenue will be committed to Sea Shepherd Australia for a minimum of 10 years from start-up
  • Our objective short term is to get a sustainable foot hold into the Australian Offshore Marine operators market. Moving forward, SEISMEC will strive to increase the fleet via further vessel acquisitions and new builds using the latest "Green" technology for ships and promote a truly Global Business. 

What We Need & What You Get

  •  SEISMEC require USD5M to secure the assets and begin operations. we have already sent contracts to the owners totalling USD3.7M. These contracts have been accepted. In addition to the above CAPEX we have slipway, repair and re-survey costs estimated at USD440K. For the first three months of OPEX and set-up we require USD360K. In addition there is a front end donation of USD500K to Sea Shepherd in Australia. By month three all four vessels will be hired on bareboat charter. At this time the company will become self funding with an EBIT of approx. 40%
  • You will receive a certificate showing how much you contributed. There will be an explanation on this certificate of SEISMEC`s unique Marine Environment Protection Program. 20% of SEISMEC`s net income will be donated to Sea Shepherd Australia for a minimum period of 10 years.
  • If this campaign fails to meet its funding goal, then the monies collected will go towards securing traditional Bank Finance using the ships as collateral. The ratio of donations to Marine Environment Protection will also be affected. For example, if we only raise USD3M then this represents upfront donation to Sea Shepherd Australia of USD300K and a reduction of the 20% annual donation to Marine Protection by 40% making the annual donation factor 12% for minimum 10 years.
  • Should we exceed our funding goal, the annual 20% donation to Marine Environment Protection remains intact. The upfront donation to Sea Shepherd Australia will remain at 10% of net campaign funds raised (net = after Indiegogo fees). The excess to funding goal amount will be put towards accelerating our further asset purchases which in turn increases the annual donation to Sea Shepherd.

The Impact

  •  By contributing to this campaign you will be supporting an International Marine company that directly contributes a large percentage of their profits to saving and maintaining our Global Marine Environment. Your contribution will, through our unique and innovative 10 year campaign increase the fiscal value of SEISMEC`s annual donantion to Sea Shepherd . We fully expect to continue the Marine Environment Protection Program indefinitely.
  • SEISMEC Management team has extensive experience in running Marine operations around the World.
  • This is a campaign built on tangible and realistic objectives.

Other Ways You Can Help

  •  If you cannot contribute but believe in the campaign, please pass on this campaign to your Friends and colleagues.
  • Also, try using sharing on facebook, tweet or blog the campaign. Anything that gets the positive news out.

story:
Why Are You Here?
Want to help save sea turtles and dugongs from being butchered alive and sold in an illegal meat trade, but don’t want to give up your day job, become an activist, wave rainbow banners or write letters to your local politicians?
Great!  Because we have a solution that helps you help us save these amazing creatures; without having to go any further than your computer, laptop or smart phone….

What We Need...

All you have to do is a make a donation (of any size) to help us reach our target of $10,000 and we’ll do the rest.  What’s the rest?  Well, we’ll fly around the country to ask scientists, politicians, activists, tour operators and traditional owners their thoughts on the unsustainable hunting of our sea turtles and dugongs, and what they think of the illegal trade.

Sound boring? Well that’s ok, because we’re also going to sneak around with night vision, film the trade with hidden cameras, chase poaches around remote islands and creeks in a busted up tinny and a few other cool things that we can’t disclose right now…all to make sure our sea turtles and dugongs can stay safe and happy.

Okay, sounds good so far but where does the money actually go?  Your money will help us cover flights, accommodation and some equipment costs to make sure we get to our interviews on time and into the trade hotspots.  Just to make sure your money goes even further we won’t pay any of the crew and we’ll make them eat beans and rice for days on end…..

… & What You Get

So what else do you get aside from saving a couple of freaking amazing oceanic creatures from extinction and bumping up your ocean karma?  Well, that depends on how much you chuck in the tin, but there’s heaps of unique prizes on offer here to get you started.

Whats The Impact?

This documentary aims to expose the truth about the unsustainable harvest of sea turtles and dugongs in Australia.  It seeks to question the role of traditional hunting in a contemporary setting and discover how or if it can persist into the future; without costing the existence of two incredible species.

The campaign to follow will pressure the government, regulators and community groups to change current legislation, enforcement standards and conservation goals to ensure that turtle and dugong populations are safeguarded into the future.  By highlighting the flaws of our current system, and taking lessons from indigenous ranger programs abroad, we believe this campaign will be able to offer realistic solutions to the complex problems at hand.

    Risks & Challenges

      Can we promise that this one campaign will completely stop the slaughter of sea turtles and dugongs in Australia? No, but we can promise that this campaign will speak loudly for those that can not, and that we will fight tooth and nail to change the laws that currently allow for the slaughter.  Every movement must start with one voice, as every ocean must begin with a single drop.  Help us be the drop that saves Australian sea turtles and dugongs.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Can't afford to donate?  Thats ok, there's plenty of ways you can help change the future for Australian sea turtles and dugongs.  Perhaps you could donate a skill set like web or graphic design or animation, be one of our film crew, provide free legal advice, be our eyes on the water and report any cruel or illegal activities through our Price Per Dozen website.

      Help spread the word by liking us on Facebook and encouraging others to do so, write to politicians asking them to ban the hunting of threatened and endangered species, start the conversation with friends and colleagues and get them onboard!

      Incentives


             GoPro Black  

      Dave Williams Art              

        PADI Open Water Dive Course

      Pete Bethune - Whale Warrior     

                Dugong Art

                                     Mirage Snorkel Set

                                  Dive Torch 




                           Turtle Books (1 of 4)            

       

                                                                  Cristal D'Arques

story:
The Issue

There is remarkable community-based climate change work being done around the world, but we don’t hear much about it.  Our goal is to share, learn from, and build upon these innovations and successes. 

In addition, the narrative of climate change remains a fear-based message of disaster.  Fear does not inspire.  We want to change that narrative, and lead with a message of hope.

People need to see that change is possible – and see a way forward.           Our goal is to make that happen.

Our Project

To reach as many people as possible, we are combing documentary film, community engagement, and policy with this project.  We will be working with 6 local communities in 5 countries to:

  • Produce a feature-length film – one that shares the remarkable work being done around the world, shows people that change is possible, and inspires people to be involved.
  • Develop a toolkit to help communities and practitioners around the world understand and replicate these innovative approaches.
  • We also want to give something back in the process, so we're offering media trainings on low-cost film, to help communities share their stories and success around the world, to propel innovation, experimentation, and adaptation.

We’re in the process of making the film, toolkit and planning out the workshops, but we need your help to complete them!  That’s why we’re reaching out! 

In return for your support, we've created some exciting rewards to show our thanks! For example, you can choose a photo print or, better yet, get a signed etching from a numbered series. (Not only is Tom Miller a filmmaker, but he is an artist.  You can see a sample of his work in the above gallery.) Also, our great friend and artist Sayuri Sasaki Hemann has donated some beautiful fabric jellyfish.  Or, you could even send a small item of your choosing on the road with us and we’ll document its journey. (See rewards for details.)  And, of course, digital downloads of the film, producer credits, and many more treats!  

Why should I support your project?

Well, if you agree with the following, you'll love this project... 

  • You want to watch a climate change film that portrays hope and a positive way forward.
  • You want to help communities share their successful climate adaptation practices around the world.
  • You believe in empowering communities to share their stories in their own voice. 
  • You believe that community resilience is important.
  • You love documentaries with beautiful cinematography.
  • You're curious to track the team during their travels around the world.
  • You know that there are communities already addressing climate change and you want to learn from them.
  • You like movies that explore alternative social and cultural ideas. 
  • You like receiving behind the scenes photos and videos.
  • You have an adventurous spirit.

What is our Indiegogo goal?

We’ve set our goal at $35,000. You might be scratching your heads and asking why such a low figure.  If we can, we would like to raise more than this to include additional locations and support more workshops.  There are a lot of things we’d like to do if we had the funds, there’s no question about that. We just want to have a grounded approach and fly a little higher if we exceed our goals. Every bit helps.

Your contribution will cover our filming expenses, help cover our research for the toolkit, and support our training workshops!

We are also committed to reducing the environmental impact of our work as much as we can, and offsetting where we can’t.  Your contributions to this project will not only help us meet this goal, but will also provide funding for clean water to families in Ghana.  We will invest in offsets from our travels in the Ghana Clean Water Project through Native Energy

How do I follow the project?

  • If you make a contribution, you’ll be sure to get regular updates as we document our project!
  • Get social, and help us spread the word!  Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Tumblr.
  • Sign up for our newsletter to get updates on our project and info on how to get involved.

What happens if we help you exceed your goal?

Not only will we be elated, but the pledges that come in, after we exceed our goal, will go towards including more locations, holding more workshops and making it an even better film. We'll also include some awesome stretch goal rewards that we'll announce when we reach that point.   

What is out there?

Right now, there are communities around the world adapting to the impacts of a changing climate. These communities have incredibly important, on-the-ground knowledge and strategies, which can provide profound benefits to both our local and global adaptation and transformation efforts. These communities are creating the solutions, now we need to learn how to share them.

What's holding us back?

Unfortunately, the value of local knowledge and community-based adaptation efforts is often overlooked or misunderstood by planners, practitioners, and government.  In addition, small communities often lack the resources necessary to connect with these groups to finance, develop, and expand upon their efforts and knowledge.  Finally, communities are often limited in their capacity to share their knowledge with other communities. The result is that we are unable to learn from, share information with, or provide feedback to other communities engaged in similar crucial adaptation efforts.

What needs to happen?

1) We need to recognize the value of local knowledge, indigenous perspectives, and community-based responses to climate change so they can become a part of our global climate change dialog.

2) We need to build the tools to connect practitioners and communities, so together we can develop strategic and replicable responses to climate change.

3) We need to build the capacity in communities to share and access important knowledge and information. This type of knowledge exchange will facilitate more rapid and effective climate adaptation.

How do we get there?

Our solution has three parts:

A Film - Designed with a general audience in mind, our documentary film will tell intimate, human-based stories of people and communities adapting their lives to a changing climate. Our film will follow successes, challenges, and demonstrate the inherent value of localized knowledge, indigenous perspectives, and adaptation efforts. And unlike many climate change films that lead with messages of fear, ours will lead with positive examples of success and hope. By offering practical and positive ways forward - those based on the efforts of everyday people - we hope to inspire people all over the world to take action in their own communities.

Toolkit - Geared toward planning and policy practitioners, as well as communities, our toolkit will facilitate a deeper understanding of how to support community-led climate responses from both sides. It will provide guidance to professionals not familiar with community-based climate responses, with the goal of developing more strategic approaches and replicating successful practices.  The toolkit will be published online and available for free for public use. 

Media Trainings - Included in the documentary, and aimed at the community level, we will provide low-cost film trainings, to help communities share their stories and success around the world, to propel innovation, experimentation, and adaptation. This exchange of knowledge will help participants reduce the risks of climate change in their own communities.

Finally, the nice things people are saying about us: 

Our Place on Earth was featured in Ensia Magazine in their "notable" section, alongside the great UN project Momentum for Change.  You can read the article here:  http://ensia.com/notables/#notable9179

“Our Place on Earth has an incredibly strong vision.  With their workshops and toolkit, they’re focused on the value of community participation and engagement, which is absolutely critical.  And I like that they’re trying to do something different with their film – to document intimate, personal, and inspiring portraits of climate change success.  It’s so important to show people a positive way forward – to demonstrate solutions.  Please help them get this message out there.  It's one we really need to hear." 

- Mikell O'Mealy

USAID Climate Change Advisor

*******

"Humans have always had to experiment with ways to adapt and survive, and in the process we've generated extensive and sophisticated local knowledges about the human-environment relationship.  But now, with the scale of global climate change, the knowledge being produced through adaptation experiments all over the world needs to be disseminated as rapidly as possible.

Our Place on Earth promises not only to tell these promising adaptation stories through film and other media, but also to build a toolkit where case studies in adaptation can be accessed, modified, and then applied in other contexts. This is precisely the tool needed to transmit the new knowledge we must rapidly acquire if we hope to find equitable and just ways for the world's population to live on a hotter planet. "

-Stephen Zavestoski

PhD Sustainability Director 
College of Arts & Sciences Co-Chair, Environmental Studies
University of San Francisco

Project team 

Nuin-Tara Key is a research and policy consultant in climate change and urban development. She is lead researcher for the practitioner’s toolkit and a technical consultant and producer for the documentary. 

Tom Miller is a filmmaker, artist, and owner of PrettyGoodProductions, a film production company with a focus on social justice issues. Tom is the director and producer for the documentary film for Our Place on Earth.

ourplaceonearth.org 
info@prettygoodproductions.net


Additional Links:

http://sayurisworld.bigcartel.com/category/jellies

Video I did of Sayuri's Work: https://vimeo.com/94300786

story:
Help Me Turn Machu Picchu Purple for Epilepsy Awareness

My wife, Carolina Barcelos Carneiro de Oliveira Miller died as a result of Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) in August 2011.  She was only 25.  Like many, I wasn't aware that epilepsy could be fatal.  Carolina had been diagnosed with epilepsy in her teenage years and took medication daiy to supress any seizures.  In fact during our 5-6 years together, she only had 2 seizures, with one being tragically fatal.  Since that most horrific tragedy, I have been working tirelessly to raise epilepsy awareness in Carolina's honor.

I've come to find out that 50,000 people die in the US every year from epilepsy related causes. And that recent studies prove that 1 in 26 people will develop epilepsy in their lifetime.  1 in 10 will have a seizure.  Very alarming numbers that need to be communicated.  Epilepsy isn't given the proper attention in terms of awareness and research funding.  Most people remain sorely limited in their knowledge regarding epilepsy while 65 million people live with it everyday.

And so everyday I work to change the way the worlds sees and understands epilepsy. 

I actively run a very successful Facebook page and series of concerts with international touring artists that are streamed all over the world.  That series is called Candlelight Concerts for Epilepsy Awareness.  In March 2013, it reached a national level with 50 Concerts in 50 States for Epilepsy Awareness and included such performers as Eric Clapton, Garbage, Colbie Callait, Aimee Mann, Rita Coolidge, Imagine Dragons, Macklemore, They Might Be Giants and literally hundreds more.  More info can be found on the website at http://www.candlelightconcert.org and on the Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/candlelightconcert, which has well over 10,000 likes at present and reaches over 200k people per week with the content published and produced.  Again, all in the name of raising awareness and spreading facts about epilepsy.  Also for the climb specifically - http://www.facebook.com/epilepsyclimb

In August of 2013, on the 2 year anniversary, I ran the first Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights campaign - and climbed Mt Kilimanjaro and "turned it purple."  I reached the summit on the anniversary of Carolina's passing.  Again, in the name of raising awareness.  Between my three Facebook pages, the updates of the journey reached tens of thousands of people - hopefully helping to inspire, teach, fight stigmas and move forward messages about epilepsy beyond the "epilepsy community."  On that summit date, hundreds of users also engaged the campaign by sharing images, changing their profile pictures to an image I'd created ("Today I'm Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights") and reached easily into the tens of thousands.

That effort was documented as the central theme in a documentary about epilepsy being created by Epilepsy Film/Brain Quake.  More on that to come.  The Director of Photography, Ayaz Asif, joined me on that journey.  His photography is simply stunning and many of his stills can be seen on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/AyazAsifPhotography

It's my goal on the three year anniversary of Carolina's passing, to once again Take Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights.  Again with Ayaz documenting.  I'm hoping to lead a group of about 10-20 persons with epilepsy, epilepsy advocates, passionate supporters and caregivers this time (not doing it solo as with Kilimanjaro) along the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu.  Machu Picchu is a 7 day trek and this funding campaign is for to tour and flight costs for myself and Ayaz.  We have the majority of the gear needed, but I'm including a very small budget for that as well, and adding in the % taken by IndieGogo.  Anything beyond what our expenses are, will be donated to the epilepsy charities I consistantly work with.

 From the 2013 campaign...

 

What We Need & What You Get

This fundraising effort is specifically to cover our costs - travel (about $1500 *2), climbing group fees (about $1000 *2), equipment (about $400 *2) and incidentals.  We will NOT keep a single penny.  Any overages after costs will be donated to the various epilepsy charities I work with.

Please check out some of the perks that you would receive if you were so kind to support me in this effort.

  • $25 - Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights Pack. which includes epilepsy awareness bracelet(s), buttons, stickers & general purple swag.  50 of these will be available.
  • $100 - Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights T-Shirt. which includes all the goodies listed above PLUS a t-shirt.
  • $150 - Ayaz Asif Photo of Machu Picchu.  Ayaz will make available a selection of photos from this trek (or from our previous Purple Kilimanjaro journey if you prefer) and you can choose a print from this collection.  For samples of his work (and you will NOT be disappointed!!), visit http://www.ayaz.com and http://www.facebook.com/ayazasifphotography.com (has material from Kilimanjaro)
  • $250 - I Carry Your Photo to  the Summit.  Want to dedicate this effort to a loved one living with or lost to epilepsy?  It would be my honor to take a high-res photo at the peak of the mountain with a photo/small banner for your loved one. Or of your epilepsy awareness organization logo, whatever. It must be SMALL & carry-able.  Dimensions TBD, remember I will be carrying it with me in a backpack for about 8 days!  When doing Kilimanjaro, I laminated 8x10 photos to make them weatherproof and it worked really well!  I'd ask you to email me the high-res photo of your choosing shortly before our departure.  For the Kilimanjaro folks who sponsored at this level, I also found a nice little purple souvenir from "in-country", I'll try doing the same while in Peru.
  • $750 - Just Because You're Awesome.  For those who REALLY support this effort, you'll receive all of the aforementioned perks plus special shout-outs, hugs and an endless lifetime supply of me telling you that you're awesome!!

 

The Impact

In terms of awareness, this will be a significant effort.  As with the Candlelght Concerts for Epilepsy Awareness, I will shout this story from the mountaintops (quite literally) to all media outlets who will listen.  With the concerts, we've had coverage in all local Philadelphia/New Jersey media and some very high-profile pieces in USA Today and across many digital media outlets, both in the US and internationally.  We've been in print, on TV and on radio and continue to do so.  We're even featured in some upcoming documentaries about epilepsy. This will continue to tell that story - in the hope to really change the way the world sees & understands epilepsy through more media coverage.

Some of those stories can be seen here, here, here, here, here, here, here, or here.

This will continue that momentum and take it to greater heights!  Pun intended!

I will climb around the anniversary of Carolina's passing.  It's my hope to be at the summit on the anniversary, which is August 22nd as we did with Kilimanjaro in 2013.

I will release press releases, do interviews and take EVERY opportunity to talk to ANYONE and use this effort to share the facts and information about epilepsy.

I will also continue to promote very heavily and continuously on Facebook, which will reach people in the hundreds of thousands.

Other Ways You Can Help

Again, this effort is to cover our costs with any overages being donated.  You are extremely welcome and encouraged to make donations to the various epilepsy charities I work on on my website - http://www.epilepsyclimb.org/default.asp

The most important way you can help is to tell your friends.  This effort is all about raising awareness for epilepsy.  Please visit my website and Facebook page for daily info, statistics and resources all about epilepsy.  And please share.  Read, learn and tell your friends - I cannot do this alone, everyone in the community needs to help tell these stories; together we can change the way the world sees and understands epilepsy!!

You can also use the IndieGogo share tools to help spread the word above this particular campaign.

Please help us to turn Machu Picchu for epilepsy awareness!
story_txt:
Help Me Turn Machu Picchu Purple for Epilepsy Awareness
My wife, Carolina Barcelos Carneiro de Oliveira Miller died as a result of Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) in August 2011.  She was only 25.  Like many, I wasn't aware that epilepsy could be fatal.  Carolina had been diagnosed with epilepsy in her teenage years and took medication daiy to supress any seizures.  In fact during our 5-6 years together, she only had 2 seizures, with one being tragically fatal.  Since that most horrific tragedy, I have been working tirelessly to raise epilepsy awareness in Carolina's honor.I've come to find out that 50,000 people die in the US every year from epilepsy related causes. And that recent studies prove that 1 in 26 people will develop epilepsy in their lifetime.  1 in 10 will have a seizure.  Very alarming numbers that need to be communicated.  Epilepsy isn't given the proper attention in terms of awareness and research funding.  Most people remain sorely limited in their knowledge regarding epilepsy while 65 million people live with it everyday.
And so everyday I work to change the way the worlds sees and understands epilepsy.  I actively run a very successful Facebook page and series of concerts with international touring artists that are streamed all over the world.  That series is called Candlelight Concerts for Epilepsy Awareness.  In March 2013, it reached a national level with 50 Concerts in 50 States for Epilepsy Awareness and included such performers as Eric Clapton, Garbage, Colbie Callait, Aimee Mann, Rita Coolidge, Imagine Dragons, Macklemore, They Might Be Giants and literally hundreds more.  More info can be found on the website at http://www.candlelightconcert.org and on the Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/candlelightconcert, which has well over 10,000 likes at present and reaches over 200k people per week with the content published and produced.  Again, all in the name of raising awareness and spreading facts about epilepsy.  Also for the climb specifically - http://www.facebook.com/epilepsyclimb
In August of 2013, on the 2 year anniversary, I ran the first Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights campaign - and climbed Mt Kilimanjaro and "turned it purple."  I reached the summit on the anniversary of Carolina's passing.  Again, in the name of raising awareness.  Between my three Facebook pages, the updates of the journey reached tens of thousands of people - hopefully helping to inspire, teach, fight stigmas and move forward messages about epilepsy beyond the "epilepsy community."  On that summit date, hundreds of users also engaged the campaign by sharing images, changing their profile pictures to an image I'd created ("Today I'm Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights") and reached easily into the tens of thousands.
That effort was documented as the central theme in a documentary about epilepsy being created by Epilepsy Film/Brain Quake.  More on that to come.  The Director of Photography, Ayaz Asif, joined me on that journey.  His photography is simply stunning and many of his stills can be seen on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/AyazAsifPhotography

It's my goal on the three year anniversary of Carolina's passing, to once again Take Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights.  Again with Ayaz documenting.  I'm hoping to lead a group of about 10-20 persons with epilepsy, epilepsy advocates, passionate supporters and caregivers this time (not doing it solo as with Kilimanjaro) along the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu.  Machu Picchu is a 7 day trek and this funding campaign is for to tour and flight costs for myself and Ayaz.  We have the majority of the gear needed, but I'm including a very small budget for that as well, and adding in the % taken by IndieGogo.  Anything beyond what our expenses are, will be donated to the epilepsy charities I consistantly work with.
 From the 2013 campaign...

 
What We Need & What You Get
This fundraising effort is specifically to cover our costs - travel (about $1500 *2), climbing group fees (about $1000 *2), equipment (about $400 *2) and incidentals.  We will NOT keep a single penny.  Any overages after costs will be donated to the various epilepsy charities I work with.
Please check out some of the perks that you would receive if you were so kind to support me in this effort.


$25 - Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights Pack. which includes epilepsy awareness bracelet(s), buttons, stickers & general purple swag.  50 of these will be available.


$100 - Taking Epilepsy Awareness to New Heights T-Shirt. which includes all the goodies listed above PLUS a t-shirt.


$150 - Ayaz Asif Photo of Machu Picchu.  Ayaz will make available a selection of photos from this trek (or from our previous Purple Kilimanjaro journey if you prefer) and you can choose a print from this collection.  For samples of his work (and you will NOT be disappointed!!), visit http://www.ayaz.com and http://www.facebook.com/ayazasifphotography.com (has material from Kilimanjaro)


$250 - I Carry Your Photo to  the Summit.  Want to dedicate this effort to a loved one living with or lost to epilepsy?  It would be my honor to take a high-res photo at the peak of the mountain with a photo/small banner for your loved one. Or of your epilepsy awareness organization logo, whatever. It must be SMALL & carry-able.  Dimensions TBD, remember I will be carrying it with me in a backpack for about 8 days!  When doing Kilimanjaro, I laminated 8x10 photos to make them weatherproof and it worked really well!  I'd ask you to email me the high-res photo of your choosing shortly before our departure.  For the Kilimanjaro folks who sponsored at this level, I also found a nice little purple souvenir from "in-country", I'll try doing the same while in Peru.


$750 - Just Because You're Awesome.  For those who REALLY support this effort, you'll receive all of the aforementioned perks plus special shout-outs, hugs and an endless lifetime supply of me telling you that you're awesome!!

 
The Impact
In terms of awareness, this will be a significant effort.  As with the Candlelght Concerts for Epilepsy Awareness, I will shout this story from the mountaintops (quite literally) to all media outlets who will listen.  With the concerts, we've had coverage in all local Philadelphia/New Jersey media and some very high-profile pieces in USA Today and across many digital media outlets, both in the US and internationally.  We've been in print, on TV and on radio and continue to do so.  We're even featured in some upcoming documentaries about epilepsy. This will continue to tell that story - in the hope to really change the way the world sees & understands epilepsy through more media coverage.
Some of those stories can be seen here, here, here, here, here, here, here, or here.
This will continue that momentum and take it to greater heights!  Pun intended!
I will climb around the anniversary of Carolina's passing.  It's my hope to be at the summit on the anniversary, which is August 22nd as we did with Kilimanjaro in 2013.
I will release press releases, do interviews and take EVERY opportunity to talk to ANYONE and use this effort to share the facts and information about epilepsy.
I will also continue to promote very heavily and continuously on Facebook, which will reach people in the hundreds of thousands.
Other Ways You Can Help
Again, this effort is to cover our costs with any overages being donated.  You are extremely welcome and encouraged to make donations to the various epilepsy charities I work on on my website - http://www.epilepsyclimb.org/default.asp
The most important way you can help is to tell your friends.  This effort is all about raising awareness for epilepsy.  Please visit my website and Facebook page for daily info, statistics and resources all about epilepsy.  And please share.  Read, learn and tell your friends - I cannot do this alone, everyone in the community needs to help tell these stories; together we can change the way the world sees and understands epilepsy!!
You can also use the IndieGogo share tools to help spread the word above this particular campaign. 
Please help us to turn Machu Picchu for epilepsy awareness!

story:
Hello,

My name is Lauren and I am graduating March 2014 with a degree in Digital Film and Video Production. I am currently finishing my senior thesis film on the conservation of white sharks in California. I am raising money so I can participate in a two month internship working with the Shark Warrior Project in South Africa. Shark_Warriors_Volunteer_Program_

My documentary is the first of its kind to come out of my college. I have been active in the Shark community since moving to San Francisco in 2010. I have been a volunteer with Sea Stewards (a shark and ocean conservation organization based in the San Francisco Bay Area) with support to CA  Assembly Bill 376, ban the sale and possession of shark fins. As well as a volunteer with the Ocean Research Foundation which is dedicated to the advancement of marine conservation. Their primary goals are to support and conduct marine research and education to enhance stewardship of ocean resources. I am also an intern at Greenpeace USA,  I work with Greenpeace Semester recruitment staff to help coordinate outreach and relationship building with new applicants and our various networks. I assist with vetting of applications and scheduling interviews, and will manage a piece of ongoing marketing and recruitment strategy. I am also a White Shark Naturalist with the Gulf of the Farallones National Marine Sanctuary.  This campaign is important to me because of my passion for Shark research and conservation, I have been wanting to travel to South Africa to see white sharks and have the chance to swim with them while doing what I love (film making)! I can not express the magnitude of gratitude I have for your contribution.

The Break down:

  • I will need $5,609 to participate in this Internship. The money will go to travel: to and from South Africa from San Francisco, camera gear, internship fees, visa fees and living expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it. 

Thank you so much for your contribution, It means the world to me and the future of sharks around the world.

-Lauren

story:
Summary

We all want to live a good life. Most want to help create a better world. More and more are hearing the call to live in close relation with Nature, and to learn first hand what it means to provide for the very essentials of life: food and medicine, shelter, clothing, community.

By sheer Fortune or good Karma, we were given the opportunity to inhabit a small portion of our Mother Earth. We received the stewardship of 10 hectares of agricultural land in the Misiones province, in northeastern Argentina, where the world famous Iguazu falls are located.

We have settled this land with no facilities; there is no house, no electricity, gas stoves, or phone signal…. We do enjoy drinking pure spring water, firewood cooking, bathing in the river, and all the surprises that living outdoors entails.

The garden is growing, as well as the fruits of our manual creative labor, as we learn to make our own furniture, shelter, even kitchen utensils!

Sharing our learning process is one of the main priorities, so the idea came to host a natural building workshop, in which we can reach out to locals.

People in this province –mostly from European descent- have not embraced the ancient wisdom of the original inhabitants of this land, the Guarani Nation. Specifically, no one builds with mud anymore… the norm is wooden plank houses, which offer no insulation against the weather, decay very fast in this weather, and add to the rate of deforestation of the region.

Even though it is a natural paradise, this is an impoverished province, and rural people struggle to meet their needs, seeing no options other than to cut down the jungle in order to grow highly chemicalized tobacco, tea and yerba mate, and monocultures of pine trees and eucalyptus.

 What We Need & What You Get

As we have dedicated our lives to this project, we have had to -temporarily- surrender other conventional modes of fundraising (e.g. jobs!).

In order to host the workshop, build a small cabin and take one huge step towards self-reliance, we will need some manual tools (enough for workshop attendants) and building materials (mainly sand, metal roofing, nails and such).

We are committed to building as much with natural materials as possible, harvesting what we can from where we are, such as the clay, stone, bamboo...

We are intending to grow enough food to supply for the people attending the workshops, so as the veggies grow we need to sustain ourselves and continue to buy seed and groceries...

One of the main goals is to establish a food forest to restore the fields, so some of the funding will go to buying fruit and native hardwood trees, always aimed at increasing the diversity.

 The Impact

 By hosting a natural building workshop, and actively inviting locals to participate free of charge, we are hoping to spread our enthusiasm for mud and its many advantages (such as preserving trees from being cut down for new houses and improving the quality of life of the inhabitants).

We are hoping to share the ways in which we are learning to free ourselves from further enriching the middlemen. Organically grown food, alternative energy sources, communal ownership of equipment are all part of the approach.

There are already many people and projects in the province working towards true sustainability and wholesome living.

We are inspired to expand and enrich this web of guardians of seed and naturaldiversity.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily, please spread the word about us and about the situation in this region, both the immense challenges and the hopeful projects that coexist.

Creative input, practical advice, spiritual support and hard working volunteers are more than welcome!

And... organic seeds are highly valued!!!!

story:
ABOUT US

Ghana Youth Climate Coalition (GYCC) is a youth led non-governmental organization founded in 2011 with the aim of mobilizing, educating, inspiring and empowering the youth to become agents of change and also advocate on climate change and environmental related issues of concern in Ghana.

The Ghana Youth Climate Coalition is made up of a team of dedicated youth who have a passion for the environment. Even though the activities of the organization have mostly been self-funded, the team’s passion for the environment has been a form of inherent motivation for in mobilizing a group of like-minded individuals to pursue projects and activities to fulfill the objectives of the organization. These successfully organized series of projects predominantly aim at achieving environmental awareness and education. Notable among these projects are the Green Initiative Tour, One Tree One Life Initiative and World Environmental Day Celebrations, which have primarily been in the form of campaigning and awareness creation, general clean up exercises and mass tree planting exercises in the Ashanti Region and Some parts of Western Region. GYCC, which is now one of the largest proactive youth led environmental organizations in Ghana, in partnership with the Ghana Youth Environmental Movement (GYEM) and Technology without Boarders-Ghana (TeoG) organized the Power-Shift Summit 2014 and the Recycle-up Summer Camp 2014 respectively.

The Power-Shift Summit 2014, was the largest youth led environmental summit in Ghana, which brought together over 500 participants who were educated on how to take a stand for climate and environmental justice in Ghana. The Recycle-Up Summer brought together 30 senior high school participants from different schools throughout the Ashanti Region, who were trained and mentored to develop innovative solutions to the current plastic waste management problems that Ashanti Region is facing. The participants with the most innovative and feasible solutions were then given a seed fund to start up their initiatives.

We are currently soliciting for support to expand the scope of our activities to cover additional four regions in Ghana in the year 2015. Hence the Climate Change Awareness and Youth Empowerment, which will be an all year project come 2015.

WHY CLIMATE CHANGE AWARENESS AND YOUTH EMPOWERMENT?

One of the United Nations’ Millennium Development Goals states that “Environmental Sustainability” must be ensured. We at GYCC believe that, ongoing education and awareness creation around environmental issues is the only way possible to achieve this goal. Thus, the Climate Change Awareness and Youth Empowerment campaign will help Ghana achieve a climate literate youth who will be proactive and innovative in advocacy for climate fairness as well as in mitigating and adapting to climate change in Ghana.

WHAT WE WILL ACHIEVE

We will build a network of youth activists throughout the country through awareness creation and training seminars and making available educational materials to target groups as well as forming and engaging "green clubs" and chapters in second cycle institutions and tertiary institutions throughout five regions in Ghana, namely Ashanti, Northern, Central, Western and Greater Accra Regions. We believe that, with a common voice, we can also make key demands from our leaders for a more pragmatic effort in dealing with climate change effectively.

Trees play an important role in addressing climate change and assisting our agricultural areas to be more sustainable. They can also assist in preventing salinity and soil erosion, provide shade, shelter, food and habitat to native animals. With your support, we hope to plant one thousand (1,000) trees throughout the aforementioned five regions in Ghana.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We at GYCC are doing this work on a volunteer basis just like how we have gone about our previous projects. Many of us have already devoted not only time, but personal resources from the very inception of the organization. However, we cannot do it alone.

Through this campaign, we hope to raise a total of $6000 to cater for not only the transportation of members to and from 5 regions of Ghana but to also fund training, educational and awareness creation materials which would be made available to target groups. A projector will be required to facilitate presentations and educational seminars. Part of the funds will be used for the tree planting exercise of which its major expenses include the buying of one thousand (1,000) seedling to be planted in various selected communities and schools and one hundred (100) sets of planting implements for the planting process as well as transporting seedlings and volunteers to selected locations. Provisions for monitoring of seedlings to make sure they grow well  will also be made.

We want you to be 100% assured that, your donation will result in noticeable social and environmental change. To ensure this, our team will send you updates on our progress via email. We want to extend our gratitude for your generous support by offering unique perks for donations.

OUR CHALLENGE

From January through November 2015, GYCC will collaborate and partner up with different groups throughout five regions in Ghana, to organize, educate, train and recruit a generation of youth environmental activist. GYCC will extend the formation of Green Clubs and Chapters in various Senior High Schools and Tertiary Institutions across the country. This will be a way of promoting youth action against climate change at the grassroots.

The project will eventually create a network of individuals drawn from second cycle and tertiary institutions, other youth groups, networks and associations as well as communities that are hardest hit by the effects of climate change, who will work together to preserve the future for generations to come.

Our task is no less than ensuring a sustainable future where a healthy environment is the foundation for a sustainable economy and healthy communities. Our past experiences in related projects makes us capable of overcoming the challenges that we shall face along the way. However, we cannot overcome all the challenges without your support. Will you donate to support youth leaders to take a united and more pragmatic effort in achieving a green economy in Ghana?

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT CLIMATE CHANGE AWARENESS AND YOUTH EMPOWERMENT IN GHANA

·  Join us At the Ghana Youth Climate Coalition! Like and share our Facebook Page.

·  Help us spread the word about climate change awareness and youth empowerment in Ghana with Facebook. Post this site on your friends' walls, as your status, or send a friend a personal message!

·  Tweet the link to this site! 

·  Spread the word to your E-mail contact lists. Be sure to include this site in the email and encourage your friends to continue spreading the message.

·  Spread the word by starting up a conversation with a friend, co-worker, or a family member about how they can help to make Climate Change Awareness and Youth Empowerment in Ghana the best it can be. Forward to them the link to our page and tell them to keep spreading the word!

story:
[UPDATE 14/02] New numbers on how far we have come are in the update section!

 

What is the challenge?

 Despite the vital role as our planet´s life support system, the Amazon is still under threat from logging, mining and slash and burn traditions. Huge areas have been destroyed, and lack of resources force people to live on as little as $2 a day. Official statistics show that 60% of the children suffer from malnutrition.  

 

Who are we?

The crees foundation is a conservation and sustainable development not-for-profit organisation, that works to reduce poverty and protect biodiversity in the Amazon rainforest.

 

Our mission

crees` sustainable community project was founded as a response to these challenges in the Amazon. Through a combination of local knowledge and scientific research, we seek to protect the biodiversity of the forest while helping the local community improve their health and living standard through sustainable practices.

With help from the local community leader Reynaldo Ochoa (-watch the video in our gallery!)  and the Environmental Change Institute at Oxford University, we have created a model that enables the community to benefit from the rainforest in a sustainable way.

Over the last three years the innocent foundation has helped us with our mission, but our funding ends March 2013. We have created a blueprint of our model, but to scale this up and inspire communities all over Amazon, there is a lot more work to do. That is why we need your help!

 

How do we meet the challenges?

We build biogardens with local families to combat malnutrition using sustainable practices. crees provides resources and knowledge to produce organic fresh fruit, herbs and vegetables, ordinarily not included in diets at all, in their own backyards. These go straight to the family table and provide extra income from the surplus. In stage two we want to support up to 30 biogardens with roofs protecting them from rain, leeched soil and flooding.

We plant agroforestry plots with local farmers where native Amazon trees are planted alongside banana crops. This is a sustainable wood and crop production alternative, which conserves surrounding forest from logging activity, and protects species biodiversity. It also creates carbon credits that can be sold to provide a further income for the project to invest in more trees.  

We build knowledge and capacity through one to one training and workshops on small enterprises, sustainability and resource management.

We take the lessons learned with us into stage two. Now we want to strengthen the foundation of the project, and make expertise and resources more accessible by:

- Building a nursery that can house seedlings, fertilizer and provide a place where expertise and resources are readily available.

- Supporting the Technical Institute with a course in Natural Resource Management

- Helping families create a co-op for their agroforestry plots and biogardens - strenghtening internal cooperation and enhancing revenue by collectively supplying local lodges and tourist establishments.

- Building roofs for up to 30 of the biogardens

- Planting up to 50 hectares of agroforestry plots

 

So far we have:

- Positively affected the lives of 500 people

- Built 57 biogardens

- Planted 15 agroforestry plots

- Planted 10,000 trees

- Positively sequestrated more than 55 tons of carbon from the atmosphere

- Undertaken one to one training and capacity building workshops that build local expertise

- Built biogardens with the local primary school and planted agroforestry plots with the local Technical Institute

We are well along the path to our ultimate goal, a self-dependent, economically and environmentally sustainable future for the Manu community. However, there´s still a lot of work to be done, and to make the community truly sustainable we need your help.

 

What we can do with your help!

We have finished stage one, which has been a milestone in itself. Now we need to ensure that the platform we have built is developed and ready to inspire others.

With your help we can scale up and:

- Plant up to 10 more biogardens a year

- Build up to 30 roofs for the biogardens

- Plant up to 50 hectares of agroforestry plots

- Kickstart the most commited families to create a co-op for the agroforestry plots and biogardens.

- Build a nursery where we can produce seedlings and organic fertilizer, a place providing readily available resources, tools, and expertise

- Hold more workshops to support local knowledge on sustainability, small enterprises and resource management

- Develop the local Technical Institute with a course in Natural Resource Management and Eco-tourism, supporting both general Peruvian and local expertise on sustainability

 

By donating you will help generate healthier and more positive guardians of the forest, ensure sustainable development for the people of the Manu Biosphere Reserve, and enable us to fully develop our model of sustainable agriculture, so we can do our bit to create a more sustainable Amazon.

story:
CLICK HERE TO BUY NOHBO PRODUCTS FROM NOHBOBALL.COM!



An eco-friendly, biodegradable ball of shampoo for travel and everyday needs

Nohbo is a biodegradable, single-use personal care product that is eco-friendly and completely waste-free! Nohbo balls are plant-based, made without the use of harsh chemicals or formulas and also packaged with plant-based materials, making them 100% waste-free. Which means no more plastic shampoo bottles. The possibilities are endless with Nohbo. With your support, future products will include conditioners, body washes, and shaving cream balls!  


Nohbo seeks to solve environmental problems
with eco-friendly solutions that help
to prevent plastic waste in our ecosystems.

See what everyone is saying in Forbes, 
Business Insider, Shark Tank, and Inc.

Hear what CEO Benjamin Stern has been up to since getting a deal with Mark Cuban on Shark Tank: Listen to Shark Tank Podcast!





Made from the Ancient Japanese Cherry Blossom Tree

helps strengthen hair to protect against oxidative damage

powerful antioxidants help remove toxins

lathers to create rich, creamy shampoo to leave your hair feeling as light, bouncy and soft as a handful of flower petals


Made from the Ancient Sandal Wood Tree

Relaxing, cooling forest scent

Stimulates and nourishes dry hair

known for antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties


Start in the Shower 


By introducing a plastic-free alternative, we are helping to reduce the amount of plastic produced by every single shampoo bottle purchase. And since Nohbo is completely waste-free, you don't have to worry about throwing away any plastic bottles after you run out!


Nohbo is small and contains

ZERO PLASTIC 

Nohbo balls are quarter sized and fit comfortably in the palm of your hand. Which makes them perfect for taking them with you outdoors, or even for storing in your bathroom. 

Nohbo is easy to use. Once exposed to water, the Nohbo ball starts to dissolve into a lathery shampoo to use on your hair. Simply run the Nohbo shampoo ball under water, rub in your hands until you create a good lather then massage into your hair

Great uses for Nohbo

No more of those nasty rings of who-knows-what accumulating under the bottles in your shower. With Nohbo, you don’t need a bottle at all. Just grab a Nohbo ball before your shower and use it like any other shampoo. It’s cleaner, easier, and better for the planet.

Nohbo takes the guesswork out of travel: 7 day trip = 7 showers = 7 Nohbo balls. It’s that easy. No more travel-sized plastic containers. No more worrying about bottles leaking in your luggage. Nohbo balls are always light and dry — take as many as you need!

Hiking with heavy liquids, you always risk ending up with a pack full of soapy clothes. Since Nohbo balls are dry until exposed to water, you can pack light and confident. Plus, you’ll leave your favorite places just as beautiful as you found them. Explore your world waste-free with Nohbo’s compostable packaging.


Why Nohbo?



Plastic can take up to 1,000 years to decompose. Yet even after that much time, plastic remnants can still plague our ecosystems. As plastic degrades it breaks into  tinier plastics called micro-plastics. These micro-plastics get into our food supply, fish, animals, and ecosystem in ways not seen to the human eye. In turn, they disrupt digestion and can sometimes cause toxic effects in living organisms. While recycling can help reduce this effect, it is not a consistent solution.    

Not many people recycle. In fact, 4 out 5 people don't recycle any items from their bathrooms. And even then, the items that do end up in a recycling bin rarely actually get re-purposed... Collecting recyclables isn't cheap either—it uses about 50 to 60 percent of the budget of a typical curbside recycling program. In addition, most recycling programs are costly, burn more energy for the trucks to pick up the recycled items, and take a long time to process.


Hi. My name is Benjamin Stern, and I am the CEO and Founder of Nohbo. On Friday, February 19th, I got the deal of a lifetime on Shark Tank with Mark Cuban. My journey first started 2 years ago when I was 14. The idea for a single use, bottle-less shampoo ball seemed so simple. I was shocked to find there was no one on the market selling this kind of product. So I sought out to make my own. I have learned that the process of starting a business requires a lot more than just an idea. It takes tenacity and courage to pursue a dream.

I ask of you the environmentalist, the traveler, the outdoorsman, and of course the bathers such as myself, to please help us fund this Indiegogo campaign, so we can change this industry for the better!

About Nuts-'N-More Salted Caramel: 

Nuts ‘N More Salted Caramel Peanut Butter is made from only the freshest peanuts, caramel flavors, sea salt and packed with whey protein isolate and flax for added protein and Omega 3’s. nuts-n-more.com


About iLumi: 

iLumi makes bluetooth controlled LED smart bulb for indoor and outdoor use. It's energy efficient at 1-10 watts, and features an impressive iPhone or Android app to control. ilumi.co


About Villy Customs: 

Villy Customs makes custom cruiser bikes in over 1,000 color combinations so you can get your perfect bike to fit your color and lifestyle. villycustoms.com


About Bee Free Honee: 

Bee Free Honee is a liquid sweetener made in certified organic apples, and lemon juice. Bee Free Honee. Learn more about their mission at beefreehonee.com


About Qflex Acupressure: 

Q-Flex Acupressure is your personal acupressure system. Designed to help relieve tension in your upper, middle, and lower parts of your back. Learn more at: getqflex.com


About U-Lace: 

U-lace makes customizable sneaker laces. U-lace Sneaker Customizing Laces was created to empower people across the globe to simply Color Their World however they wish by lacing up their kicks with colorful laces. u-lace.com


About Smooth for Men by Simple Sugars: 

Smooth for Men, created by Simple Sugars is an all-one facial scrub used to exfoliate, and moisturize your face. We are offering their Green tea flavor. Green Tea is an antioxidant powerhouse, so it protects against free radical damage (that’s the anti-aging bit). simplesugars.com


About Monkey Mat: 

Monkey Mat is an all-purpose blanket perfect for indoor or outdoor. It's clean, portable, and comes with an attachable pouch so you can take it everywhere you go. Learn more at monkeymat.com


About Alyssas Oatmeal Cookies:

Alyssa's Oatmeal Cookies are made from scratch using only raw unrefined whole grains, naturally dried fruits, and nuts. Gluten-free, NON-GMO, with no fillers and no soy. Learn more at alyssascookies.com


Risks, Challenges, and Costs:

  • We will incur a lot of start-up costs to produce the Nohbo balls. Expenses will include distribution, packaging materials, and manufacturing costs.
  • Our first trial runs have been successful, but require further investment to develop and perfect the correct composition of our product.


FAQ:

What are the ingredients in Nohbo?

Nohbo is made from sulfate-free and paraben-free materials. Our shampoo is made with all-natural ingredients derived from plants.

I recycle already. Why do I need Nohbo?

Great question! When one recycles a plastic bottle, only 10-20% of it can actually be successfully recycled. The rest ends up slowly decaying in landfills and oceans. Plastic bottle manufacturing also uses 25% of the world’s supply of crude oil, leading to an increase in global warming conditions. Our high quality, eco-friendly shampoo balls eliminate the need for further negative environmental impact because no plastic is manufactured for our products. Nohbo is also TSA-compliant, making it perfect for traveling!

How many Nohbo shampoo balls are needed to wash my hair?
Nohbo balls are single-use, so only one ball is needed per shampoo wash.

I have long hair. Will one ball be enough? I have short hair. Can I cut a ball in half?
Only one Nohbo ball is needed to clean your hair. We also don’t recommend cutting a Nohbo ball in half, as the ball won’t create a good enough lather for a sufficient wash.

Is Nohbo safe for colored hair?
Nohbo is sulfate-free, making it much softer on colored hair than typical shampoo.

Does Nohbo test its products on animals?
No, Nohbo is an animal and cruelty free product, and its ingredients are derived from plant-based materials.

What do you have planned for Nohbo in the future?
We are developing a conditioner ball, body wash ball, and shaving cream ball! With a successful launch on Indiegogo, we can ramp up development of these exciting products.

When will my Nohbo balls be shipped?
Mid to late summer 2016

Who should I contact for wholesale or media inquiries?
Please use the contact form on our website at Nohboball.com.

Why did your cost increase?
Our cost increased due to our initial small order size but will decrease as the popularity of Nohbo shampoo balls grows.

story:
This is my journey fusing the depth and meaning of Judaism, Hawaiian spirit, and connectedness to the land and our physical and mental strength. This is the beginning of my discovery of my role in documenting and nurturing that bond in the world.


Israel

My life has brought me to a place recently that has caused me to think deeply about where I'm going. I wonder where I'm going, what I'm doing, and why I'm doing it. Everyone has these things to consider; mine are manifesting themselves now. I'm in this Elysian Fields of sorts, as my loves and wonders converge: Travel, Study of the vastness of an array of cultures, Sustainability, Connecting with the Earth, Growing Things, Filming life moments, and learning how to grow and find nourishing foods. My spirituality is also on stand; my Judaism is growing deep, fine fibers that I'm unsure of, and I'm reconnecting with these roots on a cultural level.


I have been, as you may know, presented with the opportunity to go to Israel on July 13th. I am going to Israel on July 13th. I'm not sure that I grasp that yet.


This trip is being given to me out of the graciousness of an organization called Taglit Birthright. I have been trying to go for years (really) and my little sister just recently went and returned. There is, though, a large financial calling that I've found myself attempting to fill. I bought a beautiful fine camera out-of-pocket to help record the experience and further my career in filmmaking, though I need to raise more money for a 'point-and-shoot' camera. I need SD cards and then, later, a computer that can handle the video files. I have never shot video on this camera, though that is the purpose for which I bought it. I have already purchased a phone for use in Israel, the plane-ticket to New York and Philadelphia (required to get to my flight out of JFK-- ouch), and I am still required to have 'tip-money' and insurance. I have had to turn down film projects that I believe in for this, because I cannot take off any more work. 


Post-Israel 

During this trip, obviously, I will not be working. After this trip, if my financial recovery is of weight, I will be attempting to bring myself further into the world of both cultural identity and self-sustainability. I want to learn the arts of survival and engage in the Jewish passion connecting us to food growth, community togetherness, and greater appreciation of the homesteading that I have come to be a part of. 


My good friend Amanda Robinson has recently shone back into my life, and we fused a connection surprising and strong. She told me of the organization that I am simply supposed to be a part of: Hazon. Hazon is what I want to come back to, bringing my Israel experience home and using it as a launchpad to continue on this path. Hazon connects bicycling, gardening, food, and Judaism. A bunch of hippie-jews riding vegetables around on bicycles? I think I'm a single-member branch of it already.


Filming It

Through these experiences, I want to begin filming and documenting all of this. I want to use my skills, my eyes, and my lens to pan out the beauty and heart in the world and in each of these activities. I want to go further and be there for a best friend's wedding in Australia in May 2012, and travel Japan in 2013. I want to see my family again in Hawaii, New York, New Orleans, and beyond. I want to connect all of this with images and words. I want to record everything. I want to film everything!


All Together Now... 

Israel? Hazon? Cameras? Computers?? Hawaii? Australia? Japan? SURVIVING IN THE FOREST?

This isn't even three-fold. It is so many fold that perhaps I'd be better off honing it down a little bit, but that's the thing-- I believe all of these things connect and I want to be a force that helps to bind them. I'm discovering something here, and it is something beautiful and intertwined. I do not like to ask for money when, from my view, it is simply for my own benefit. I've done fund-raising for many important things, but never for myself. So on the recommendation of my beautiful friend Maria, I decided to put this out there. "You are not asking for money," she told me, "You are asking for support."


I am dedicated to the sustainable, the wild-caught and the grass-fed, the home-grown and the local farmer, and how it all relates to us on a local scale, and on a global scale. I'm interested in learning how these things are approached worldwide, and in the fertile crescent, and by a culture which embraces the miracle of the earth giving these things. I want to learn how to access these, and make the accessible, and how to share them. I want to connect to people and the world through them. 


Every $1 helps. Every $5 helps. Every $20 helps. I work a lot and I try my hardest, and I certainly don't live carelessly. OF COURSE... I will NOT be hurt if you don't give money. I know most the world is having a bit of trouble, too. But... every bit helps. So here it goes. I want to raise $2000, but am charged 9% of funds raised if the goal is not made (I'm charged 4% if the goal IS made).


BUT I CAN'T JUST GIVE YOU MONEY! 

Then order a custom drawing, art, or card. I'm absolutely bubbly with the possibility of using art to help fund this. I design stuff. We can talk. I don't know if I'll have the time to complete too many projects before I go, though!
