We are North America's fastest growing online search directory for sustainable purchasing and healthier living – our site is already home to tens of thousands of listings around the world.
Our Values

Our Standards – We are committed to upholding a high level of service to ensure our platform makes a positive contribution to the marketplace, and to engage in continuous improvement.


We Believe in the Power of Good – We recognize the importance of positive incremental changes in our everyday lives, which, when combined, leads to substantial transformations on a global scale.


We Encourage Free Will With Transparency and Accountability – Our platform allows users to rank companies, products and services, and also allows businesses to respond, maintaining control over their information by being part of the conversation.


We Support Equal Access – Regardless of size, businesses have equal access to all our features and users. From the individual entrepreneur to the largest multinational, GreenPages Directory offers a power of depth and scale to bring about important changes to the sustainable marketplace.


Giving Back – Being on the leading edge takes commitment and dedication. In support of our community of conscientious innovators and entrepreneurs, we donate 10% of our advertising space to help these emerging companies introduce themselves to the marketplace.

Our Vision – Take the Next Step With Us
We can change the world, a step at a time. Take the next step with us. We’re asking for your help to provide the financing we need to continue to market and grow our listing and member base.
Our near term plans include launching the “eco-flyer” program, and the Green Pages Directory mobile app. 
The long-term plan is to build Green Pages Directory into a global database, making it the biggest and most widely used tool for environmental change in the world.
FAQ
What will my funds go towards?

The $100,000 contribution level will go towards continuing to market and grow our listing and member base, build our mobile app and launch our eco flyer program. Currently, we have 12,000 listing globally but we know that, with your support, we can grow our directory and community even more significantly in 2015 and 2016.
More importantly, your funds will help businesses and consumers around the world easily find information on the certified solutions, products and services that they need to live and operate more sustainably.


Our larger vision is to expand the GreenPages Directory into the largest database globally, helping to grow a healthy, clean and green economy worldwide. Each contribution is substantial to help us grow our database,  magnifying the positive effects our innovative platform has already had on citizens, organizations and our planet.
What has the GreenPages Directory achieved so far?
For the first time ever, our streamlined, sustainability-focused platform has made complex and in-depth information about sustainable products, services and practices easy to understand and use. We are also offering an open space for businesses of all sizes – from entrepreneurs to multinational corporations – to share best practices on creating a more sustainable economy in our community.  End-users can learn about the important issues facing industry, comment on listings and benefit from searching and browsing our database.


To date, we have built a directory with over 12,000 listings spanning all business sectors making our platform relevant for the entire economy. We have also built a network of key non-profit and NGO supporters in our community such as Nature Canada, the Pembina Institute, the Sierra Club and the Worldwatch Institute – all who share their industry knowledge to support more informed and progressive choices.
The comprehensiveness and depth of our listings is unparalleled in the world.  Most importantly, our directory is contributing towards helping businesses and consumers green our global supply chains and protect our oceans, ecosystems, drinking water and natural resources.


Can I donate from outside Canada?

Yes! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. Unfortunately we can’t accept PayPal, so the way to donate internationally is with a credit card.
What payment methods do you accept?

Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.
Can I make a contribution over $10,000?
Yes, as Indiegogo does not accept payments over $10,000, please contact info@greenpagesdirectory. We will assist you personally with the contribution transfer process.

What are some other ways that I can help?
Please share our Indiegogo campaign URL through your Facebook and Twitter accounts. If you or someone you know has an organization committed to sustainability, encourage them to create a listing in our global database.
What type of rewards will I receive by contributing to the GreenPages Directory campaign?
Please see below for the types of rewards we are offering to our contributors!





Please Note: Distribution of rewards
are subject to availability and fulfillment of the $100,000 funding level.


Is shipping included?

Yes. 

Does international shipping cost extra?


Yes, but Indiegogo doesn't allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is included in the suggested donation price.


I have more questions. Who do I ask?


Please email info@greenpagesdirectory.net and we will be happy to get back to you as soon as we can.
OUR TEAM
Connie Linder, MBA


Founder & President

Connie is an entrepreneur and business strategist with a special interest in sustainability and innovative startups. She founded GreenPages Directory to make tangible her commitment to increase public awareness of available innovative solutions and make sustainable products and services more widely accessible.
Recognized as one of Canada's top leaders and sustainability professionals, Connie has received numerous awards, including the TECHGREEN Award from the Applied Science Technologists & Technicians of BC (2014), the Women of Worth Sustainable Living Award (2013), a Queen's Diamond Jubilee Medal (2012), the Minerva Leadership Award (2012), the BC Innovation Council's New Ventures Award (2011) and named one of Canada's Top 100 Most Powerful Women as a Trailblazer/Trendsetter (2011).
Connie has an MBA from the University of British Columbia, and securities and insurance licenses from the Canadian Securities Institute. She is also a certified personal development counsellor and she studied business in Sweden, Germany and at the renowned HEC Paris.

Jarrod Goddard
Chief Technology Officer (CTO) 
Jarrod is an online entrepreneur who specializes in best practices for using the Internet for business growth. As GreenPages' CTO, Jarrod is responsible for the company's technical development.
Jarrod has a background in website development, database design and mobile applications, along with experience in online marketing, social media and search engine optimization.
Jarrod has been recognized for his technological expertise with the Technology Innovator of the Year (2012) Award, Kamloops Chamber of Commerce Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award (2010) and the EDDY Award for Technology (2004).
Ala Aoukaty, Ph.D. 
Director of Content & Research
Ala is a research scientist, immunologist and biochemist with a Ph.D. in immunology and biochemistry from UIO Faculty of Medicine and post-doctoral training at UBC's Faculty of Medicine where he worked as a research scientist and group leader.
Ala works to bring relevant certifications and innovation to GreenPages Directory and is committed to maintaining high quality content that is easily accessible to end-users.
He has received fellowships and grants from the Michael Smith Foundation, Canadian Diabetes Association, Bertram Hoffmeister, MRC, NCS, UNIFOR and NRC, and is the author of over 50 scientific publications and abstracts in respected science journals.

Olga Orda
Community Outreach Director 
Olga is a career communicator with experience in strategic communications and public relations. She is the founder of PitchPen®, a social media and technology platform serving more than 200 consultants across North America, and co-founder of a software and mobile app development firm.
At GreenPages Directory she liaises with our advocacy and community group members to ensure that relevant and timely articles and discussions are brought forward for discussion.
Olga was named one of the Globe Forum's "Emerging Environmental Leaders" and is a Canadian Youth Business Foundation Entrepreneur. She holds an MA in Communication and Culture from the University of Calgary and a BA in Communications from Simon Fraser University.

story:
Did you know that one oyster filters 50 gallons of water a day? Imagine what 1 MILLION COULD DO!

We, the Moriches Bay Project™, are trying to seed 1 MILLION oysters into Moriches Bay. 

First, thank you to all who have supported the moriches bay in our million mollusk march last year.  Once again we are asking for your help. last year we exceeded all our expectations...lets do it again this year! 


Summary:

The moriches bay project is a small grass roots project whose main focus is to improve the quality of water in our local bay. We do this primarily through oyster farming and eel grass planting. We are committed to bringing awareness to the community and educating our children....  

Founded  in 2012 the Moriches Bay Project™, a non-profit organization dedicated to the restoration and rehabilitation of Moriches Bay. 


Harmful algal blooms, frequent fish kills, the major disappearance of shellfish stock, and the desertification and weakening of shoreline and subaquatic vegetation are just some of the issues that plague our bay.  This motivated us to create solutions so that these things are not associated with the beautiful landscape and charming coastal communities lining our shores. 

We use a science-based process to clean our waters, focusing mainly on the reestablishment of oysters and eelgrass, both of which are critical to stabilizing the bay environment.  Through extensive outreach, we spread awareness about the fragility of the bay, while championing the importance of its protection.  

some of our most proud accomplishments: 

we have seeded roughly 80,000 oysters in our bay 

Established the first oyster bed in moriches bay in over 1 decade

installed the first water monitoring site in moriches bay 

initiated bay steward classes on the south shore 

put roughly 15000 eel grass shoots in the bay 

implemented a mentoring program 

we have moved west and have partnered with Brookhaven town to put our first oyster farm in the western part of moriches bay 

partner with local businesses and organizations who share our belief that we all live work or play on the bay we all have a responsibility to care for it. 

  

we are proud of the accomplishments we have reached in a short 3 years and with your help and support we can continue to grow and do more to "Save our Bay" 

 


 Last year we raised over $22,000.00 we exceeded all our exceptions  it really was incredible and waht that showed us was how much THIS community cares about the BAY....this year lets partner together and spread the word and lets raise $30,000.00 

  this will help us reach our goal of putting ONE million oysters in the bay 

 put 2 more oysters farms 

5 more monitoring systems 

continue our bay steward classes 

put another 5000 eel grass shoots into our eel grass 

and grow our oyster bed which has OVER a 85% success rate last year! 

but this all takes money - we need to 

-  purchasing healthy, compatible oyster stock from a breeding lab

-  scouting locations with local resource managers

-  construction labor and equipment

-  transportation costs such as fuel for boat and vehicle

-  monitoring and assessment by scientists of the MBP and Cornell Cooperative Extension in the following months

*Donations are also tax deductible! Get them in before the end of the year.


True to their nature, these oyster beds will create the foundation of an actual reef system, similar to coral reefs! They’ll help to filter out harmful algae that has polluted our waters, provide habitat for other marine animals, and give rise to a self-sustaining oyster population. All which essential for a healthy marine ecosystem.

We know our goal is high but we MUST set high goals because we have a tall task.. BE a part of the solution and donate Just $1.00 will put 100 oysters in the bay which will filter 500 gallons a day  which is 15,000 gallons of water every month and 182,500 EVERY year...   

make a donation any donation makes a difference then tell Just 5 friends, email them Facebook them how ever you communicate ...get the word out..  

LOOK at what we did last year with your help .....lets do it again by getting the word out there.. 

  

Find out more about our Moriches Bay Project website or visit us on Facebook

story:
The Green Driver...in brief

Here's a relatively simple solution to make a BIG dent in greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from cars, which account for one-third of all US CO2 emissions. 

  • My Project: The 150+ million vehicles in the US produce more than one-third of US greenhouse gases. Most people are "interested" in the environment but are generally unaware of how their driving habits and style exacerbate the GHG problem. They also don't think they alone can make a difference. My simple solution uses a specialized adapter -- connected to your vehicle's onboard computer -- to transmit visually compelling information to any smartphone. The information translates driving habits and style (e.g. speeding, idling, jackrabbit starts, jerky stops etc.) into effects on CO2 emissions. Every Green Driver can compare her performance to other Green Driver friends and neighbors, thereby inducing a competitive and "reward-based" approach to changing the way she drives.
  • Impact: Every gallon of gas produces 19 lbs of CO2. Check out this data from the U.S. Department of Energy. For every 100 Green Driver users who reduce their gasoline consumption by only 1 gallon per week (a cake walk with my Green Driver solution), CO2 is reduced by almost 100,000 lbs annually...you'd need about 2,000 trees to absorb that much CO2 
  • About Me: Entrepreneur and Management Consultant, undergraduate and MBA from the University of Virginia. Rose quickly through the ranks at PwC, worked in private equity for a while, then started my own consulting business about 10 years ago. My clients comprise a range of organizations including Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Citibank, Pfizer, Caterpillar, and the Federal government. Married with two children in middle school. My idea for Green Driver came from observing people in Arlington -- an otherwise "green" town -- idling all over the place. School buses, first responders, moms waiting to pick up their kids. All are seemingly oblivious to the harmful effects on the environment.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Ask: We're trying to raise $25,000 to build out beta versions of the software for both IOS and Android platforms, and to produce a run of 200 specialized bluetooth adapters for automobiles.
  • For $25, you'll get the specialized bluetooth adapter. The adapter will enable you to connect to your vehicle's onboard computer and download fault codes etc. using commercially available software. If nothing else, the adapter will give you a beat on your dealer or local mechanic so you don't get taken to the cleaners the next time the 'check engine' indicator in your car lights up.
  • For $100, you'll be the first on your block with the Green Driver package, software for either IOS or Android, plus the specialized bluetooth car adapter...and you'll be set to start saving money, the environment, and the polar ice caps. Your fuel savings alone will far exceed the $100 pledge.
That's all there is to it. Thanks

story:
Hi! I'm Kevin Swinderman. I grew up in Salinas, California, and now live in Durango, Colorado. I moved to Turku, Finland, in August of 2011 and fell in love with Nordic culture and the Nordic landscape. I began to realize that many senior citizens tend to become isolated, not just in Scandinavia but in much of the world. Seniors in their 80s and 90s, especially in Finland, participated in WW2 battles against the Soviet and Nazi armies. I, and many other people remember their contributions to freeing the world from these threats. But now I fear that many older people don't receive as much visitation as they might enjoy. If more people thought about individuals who may not have very many relatives or friends close by, they'd drop by and spend a little time, make coffee, -whatever. By hiking from Hammerfest to Turku in the middle of winter, I intend to bring word-of-mouth attention to homebound or mobility challenged senior citizens and I hope that people will take a little time to call or visit someone who might appreciate it.

 

I need money for airfare, train/bus fare, food, and incidentals. I will not stay at hotels but intend to stay with random people I meet on the trip.

Any excess funds I'll donate to local senior centers once I arrive in Finland. But let me know if you know of any special senior centers or other such places.

story:
The Amazon Express Expedition is the fulfillment of my personal ambition to be the first person to solo kayak down the entire (4225 mile) length of the Amazon River – and do it faster than anyone ever has before.

But it’s not just about kayaking, or accomplishing some sort of world record. My first visit to the Amazon in 2008 as a part of Team Easy Living (which achieved a still-held, record-setting win in the Great Amazon River Raft Race) was eye-opening.

Team Easy Living, in 2008.

(From left: Captain David Kelly, Carter Johnson, me, and Mike Scales.)

A tiny, adorable girl from a small village deep in the Amazon jungle (about 20 miles downriver from Iquitos, Peru), handed me this baby three-toed sloth.

The Amazon River was both inspiring and incredibly humbling – it is immense, a true force of nature. It is saddening to see all the industrial and human waste that spills into this jewel of the Earth, untreated and unregulated. The tiny girl with the three-toed sloth, along with so many others, are forced to drink the same water that holds these pollutions.

The Amazon is also home to some of the most remote regions in the world, many of them accessible only by water. Thus, few people outside of the local population have been there. Throughout my trip, I’ll be collecting data and samples for the Adventurers and Scientists for Conservation, a group that works with adventurers to access data from some of the world’s most remote areas.

www.adventureandscience.org

These are the things that have moved me to make this journey, and my sincere hope is that many others will help support my expedition.

To learn more about me and my family, please visit this page.

The money raised here will contribute towards our expenses as we make our way through Brazil.  We are carrying our food and gear with us, but to ensure the safety of our entire team, we need to hire river guides to assist us. 

Any money raised through this campaign will continue to provide our research with the needed funding to continue identifying at-risk water ways.

We are a 501(c)3 non-profit.

You can follow us on our blog for daily updates at www.theamazonexpress.org

story:
What is Sprout Evolution?

 Sprout Evolution is a revolutionary product that Increases Yield, Reduces Costs and is organic and 100% biodegradable. Sprout Evolution is by far the most prolific growing medium we have ever seen. It excels as a standalone medium used in hydroponics, aquaponics, mushroom cultivation and an incredible soil conditioner for customized soil mixtures.  With its high water retention rate it dramatically outperforms products made of peat moss and coconut fiber providing a nutrient rich substrate from a renewable resource.

Sprout Evolution is sourced from our crop that resides in the Hibiscus family that we personally farm in Adairville, KY and is an all natural product. There are no chemicals or additives added during any phase of the growing or manufacturing process.  Our proprietary design allows nutrients to be released at a faster and more consistent rate stimulating the growth of plants throughout the growing cycle.  Sprout Evolution eliminates the need for additional fertilizers and potentially harmful chemicals being used.

 Sprout evolution provides an out of the box all in one solution. It is all natural and made of materials that are not only more beneficial, but lower the complexity and costs of growing with optimal results.  It eliminates the time associated with maintaining intricate schedules and the total lifecycle costs associated with growing in a neutral and balanced state. From our growers who have utilized our product have validated that seeds sprout 4 times faster, hold 6 times more water per a cubic inch and reduced costs by 38% over the competition.


Why did we create Sprout Evolution?

 The market is currently dominated by a few large companies who have a monopoly on the market and stifle innovation, limiting the quality and quantity of products available to consumers. Growers have historically had two choices, work with underperforming products or develop their own products through trial and error blending several products in the quest for the perfect medium.

 We wanted to create a medium that offered a sustainable solution and does not require pesticides or fertilizers that negatively impact the environment. After extensively researching the market looking for choices that provide an all-natural chemical free sustainable solution we became frustrated in not being able to find a suitable product.

 With very few options available to us, we have embarked on a journey to be able to provide a product that will not only satisfy our strict requirements for quality and our desire to do so in a sustainable manner.  Every horticulture enthusiast and professional knows that everything begins with the earth and that is where we started.

 We rolled up our sleeves and dug in to create a solution.  After years of hard work and exhaustive studying, development and testing we have developed a product that far exceeds all of our expectations and is more successful in achieving optimum growth than we could have imagined. We feel that we are on the precipice of a major advancement in the growing industry.

 Our product is sourced from a renewable resource having a positive carbon footprint and providing a beneficial impact in the global battle against climate change. The base of our proprietary blend is so natural that prior to processing can be consumed and integrated into one’s diet.  All byproducts are recyclable and we will also offer a recycling program for our products that will be donated to causes that can extend the life of materials beyond their initial desired purpose.


Why we are here

 We want you to become part of the revolution! We have 50,000 pounds of processed material and 400,000 pounds of material ready for processing from our 2014/2015 harvest. We have 40 acres of pristine southern Kentucky farm land ready to be planted in May for the 2015/2016 growing season and harvest.  

Sprout Evolution has the unique advantage of being able to assure a quality product at every stage of the process from the farm to the consumer.  We have had to make due with aged equipment and develop new processes. As we scale up we are going to require additional machinery to be able to scale up and bring down costs and lower prices to the end consumer allowing us to compete against larger companies.


What we are doing and when

Product Lines- We have two product lines currently developed.  Our original product Sprout Evolution is geared toward your traditional soil grower. Sprout Evolution Hydro is a different blend is tailored to hydroponic and aquaponic operations. We currently are developing several additional product lines for different applications in industries including mycology, textile, pharmaceutical, fashion, energy, health and beauty, construction and as a food source.  

We are currently finalizing our packaging materials and processing operation and plan on having production ready very soon after our campaign finishes. Our packaging is going to be made out of a strong but biodegradable packaging made from corn starch using soy ink for all print material.  We are taking every step possible in providing a petroleum free packaging.  We have processing and packing equipment available to us for lease for the initial production and have plans of acquiring machinery as the company continues grows.


Young Sprouts Program- We have a partnership with local school systems in Logan County, KY where are working to build greenhouses and provide Sprout Evolution as the grow medium. We will be having workshops teaching the children and teachers how to grow hydroponically.  

We are hoping to be able to help replace an existing brown bag program where up to 70% in some areas the school children take brown bags of food home over the weekends as they will not be fed otherwise. Going into the summer this is a major initiative for us and we hope you follow our progress through the campaign and beyond.


Local Food Banks and Urban Gardens - We are forging partnerships with local food banks like Second Harvest Food Bank and urban gardens in Nashville, TN.  Not only to provide our products, but our expertise, time and experience in helping these programs become more successful and touch more lives.  We are in the early stages of these relationship and are expanding rapidly.


Team

 Our founders Jess and Kurt come from very different backgrounds but share a common admiration and passion for growing and contributing to society.  They have assembled a top notch team here at Sprout Evolution who work diligently in building a sustainable business that will not only provide a great product but give back to our communities.  

Our team is a big family and is key to our success playing a vital role in how far we have come and where we are going.  Please check out our gallery and see the whole team in action as well as testimonials and an instructional video on how to use our product done by our very own founder and farmer Jess Riggins.
story_txt: What is Sprout Evolution?  Sprout Evolution is a revolutionary product that Increases Yield, Reduces Costs and is organic and 100% biodegradable. Sprout Evolution is by far the most prolific growing medium we have ever seen. It excels as a standalone medium used in hydroponics, aquaponics, mushroom cultivation and an incredible soil conditioner for customized soil mixtures.  With its high water retention rate it dramatically outperforms products made of peat moss and coconut fiber providing a nutrient rich substrate from a renewable resource.  Sprout Evolution is sourced from our crop that resides in the Hibiscus family that we personally farm in Adairville, KY and is an all natural product. There are no chemicals or additives added during any phase of the growing or manufacturing process.  Our proprietary design allows nutrients to be released at a faster and more consistent rate stimulating the growth of plants throughout the growing cycle.  Sprout Evolution eliminates the need for additional fertilizers and potentially harmful chemicals being used.  Sprout evolution provides an out of the box all in one solution. It is all natural and made of materials that are not only more beneficial, but lower the complexity and costs of growing with optimal results.  It eliminates the time associated with maintaining intricate schedules and the total lifecycle costs associated with growing in a neutral and balanced state. From our growers who have utilized our product have validated that seeds sprout 4 times faster, hold 6 times more water per a cubic inch and reduced costs by 38% over the competition.Why did we create Sprout Evolution?  The market is currently dominated by a few large companies who have a monopoly on the market and stifle innovation, limiting the quality and quantity of products available to consumers. Growers have historically had two choices, work with underperforming products or develop their own products through trial and error blending several products in the quest for the perfect medium.  We wanted to create a medium that offered a sustainable solution and does not require pesticides or fertilizers that negatively impact the environment. After extensively researching the market looking for choices that provide an all-natural chemical free sustainable solution we became frustrated in not being able to find a suitable product.   With very few options available to us, we have embarked on a journey to be able to provide a product that will not only satisfy our strict requirements for quality and our desire to do so in a sustainable manner.  Every horticulture enthusiast and professional knows that everything begins with the earth and that is where we started.   We rolled up our sleeves and dug in to create a solution.  After years of hard work and exhaustive studying, development and testing we have developed a product that far exceeds all of our expectations and is more successful in achieving optimum growth than we could have imagined. We feel that we are on the precipice of a major advancement in the growing industry.  Our product is sourced from a renewable resource having a positive carbon footprint and providing a beneficial impact in the global battle against climate change. The base of our proprietary blend is so natural that prior to processing can be consumed and integrated into one’s diet.  All byproducts are recyclable and we will also offer a recycling program for our products that will be donated to causes that can extend the life of materials beyond their initial desired purpose.Why we are here  We want you to become part of the revolution! We have 50,000 pounds of processed material and 400,000 pounds of material ready for processing from our 2014/2015 harvest. We have 40 acres of pristine southern Kentucky farm land ready to be planted in May for the 2015/2016 growing season and harvest.  Sprout Evolution has the unique advantage of being able to assure a quality product at every stage of the process from the farm to the consumer.  We have had to make due with aged equipment and develop new processes. As we scale up we are going to require additional machinery to be able to scale up and bring down costs and lower prices to the end consumer allowing us to compete against larger companies. What we are doing and whenProduct Lines- We have two product lines currently developed.  Our original product Sprout Evolution is geared toward your traditional soil grower. Sprout Evolution Hydro is a different blend is tailored to hydroponic and aquaponic operations. We currently are developing several additional product lines for different applications in industries including mycology, textile, pharmaceutical, fashion, energy, health and beauty, construction and as a food source.  We are currently finalizing our packaging materials and processing operation and plan on having production ready very soon after our campaign finishes. Our packaging is going to be made out of a strong but biodegradable packaging made from corn starch using soy ink for all print material.  We are taking every step possible in providing a petroleum free packaging.  We have processing and packing equipment available to us for lease for the initial production and have plans of acquiring machinery as the company continues grows. Young Sprouts Program- We have a partnership with local school systems in Logan County, KY where are working to build greenhouses and provide Sprout Evolution as the grow medium. We will be having workshops teaching the children and teachers how to grow hydroponically.  We are hoping to be able to help replace an existing brown bag program where up to 70% in some areas the school children take brown bags of food home over the weekends as they will not be fed otherwise. Going into the summer this is a major initiative for us and we hope you follow our progress through the campaign and beyond.Local Food Banks and Urban Gardens - We are forging partnerships with local food banks like Second Harvest Food Bank and urban gardens in Nashville, TN.  Not only to provide our products, but our expertise, time and experience in helping these programs become more successful and touch more lives.  We are in the early stages of these relationship and are expanding rapidly.Team  Our founders Jess and Kurt come from very different backgrounds but share a common admiration and passion for growing and contributing to society.  They have assembled a top notch team here at Sprout Evolution who work diligently in building a sustainable business that will not only provide a great product but give back to our communities.  Our team is a big family and is key to our success playing a vital role in how far we have come and where we are going.  Please check out our gallery and see the whole team in action as well as testimonials and an instructional video on how to use our product done by our very own founder and farmer Jess Riggins.

story:
Here are the benefits of using BAMBU:

Soft – Easy on your hands and safe for your skin.

Super Absorbent - Absorbs 10x its weight.

Dries Fast - 4 times thicker than a paper towel and other wipes but dries 5x faster.

100 % Bamboo Fiber - Bambu is made from 100% bamboo fiber, no cotton, and no polyester. The typical bamboo cloths on the market are made from a blend of all 3.

Hypoallergenic - Breathable and odor free.

Easy to clean - Machine and hand washable.

Biodegradable - Really easy to recycle.

Natural Anti-bacterial - Anti-microbial, anti-fungal, and anti-static.

Lasts for a long time - With proper care, Bambu can last for years.

Let's compare our Bambu with other cleaning cloth out there and shammy towel
 

Bambu Vs Shammy Towel
 

Indiegogo contribution perks

How absorbent is Bambu? Here is a video showing a real time test

What can you use Bambu for?

- Clean dusty area : Bambu will absorb dust and any small particles.
- Clean your House : Kitchen area, Living room and restroom.
- Clean any Drip : Water, sauces, oil, soda and more!
- Clean your skin : From dirt, oily and greasy stain. 
- Clean your Electronics : Computer, tablet and phone. 
- Clean your pets : Dogs, Cats, Birds :)


 


Bambu Vs Cotton rags

With that said, here is something to think about;

Bambu Vs Paper towel

The paper towel industry is the third largest contributor to global warming. We owe it to ourselves, and the environment, to fully commit towards reducing waste through the elimination of paper based routines. Although the U.S. has taken great strides in “going green,” personal consumption of paper is rising higher than ever. Have you ever considered the impact your own usage of paper products has on the world? Let’s break it down even further and solely focus on our paper towel consumption.  

Paper towels have long ruled as the choice of habit, even when high-speed hand dryers or dish cloths are present. Yet they are one of the most wasteful things we spend our money on and dispose of every day without regret. It was hard to imagine that something as paper towel usage could cause such a devastating environmental impact – so we did some research. Let’s take a look at the statistics:  

• To make one ton of paper towels 17 trees and 20,000 gallons of water are polluted. 
• In the U.S. we currently use more than 13 billion pounds of paper towels each year and that number is growing steadily. This equals more than 3,000 tons of paper towel waste in the U.S. alone. 
• Globally, discarded paper towels result in 254 million tons of trash every year. 
• As many as 51,000 trees per day are required to replace the number of paper towels that are discarded every day. 
• If every household in the U.S. used just one less 70-sheet roll of paper towels, that would save 544,000 trees each year. 
• If every household in the U.S. used three less rolls per year, it would save 120,000 tons of waste and $4.1 million in landfill dumping fees.

Our Product - Bambu

The Alternative Green Project with Bambu

 There are over 1200 species of bamboo on this planet. Bambu is manufactured from the bamboo species,  moso bamboo, which is not eaten by pandas. So do not worry we didn't take any food from all the pandas in the world :)

We found a better alternative for cleaning cloth that can provide an eco-friendly solution to many of our modern requirements. Bambu is quite simply, a wonderful, green resource that is hugely beneficial both to the way we want to live our lives and to the environment.

The fiber is filled with micro gaps and micro-holes which allows for better moisture absorption and repel any Bacteria. You can rest easy knowing that after each wash, no bacteria will remain on Bambu.

Bambu is naturally antibacterial and anti-fungal because of a bacteriostatic agent unique to bamboo plants called "bamboo kun" which also helps Bambu resist harboring odors.

Manufacturing of Bambu

Bambu is weaved for 5 cycles using our advanced air jet loom machine to get the best and strongest finished product so it can last for years!

Facts about Biodegradable Bambu material

Bambu is 100% natural and biodegradable which gives conscientious consumers real peace of mind. Once you have no further use for Bambu you can rest easy, knowing that it will return to the Earth leaving a minimal environmental impact. It is so much better to enjoy a product that has a small environmental footprint and leaves barely a trace.

The world is a beautiful place - Everyday we clean, wipe and wash... Let's help ourselves by using Bambu cloth for all your cleaning purposes and make the world a better place to live.

Timeline

Sept 15th - Oct 15th 
Indiegogo Campaign

Oct 16th - Oct 31st
All contribution will be process

Nov 1st - Nov 30th
Bambu going into production

Dec 1st
All Bambu order Ship

Risks and challenges

We have the product and our manufacturer is ready to produce more of Bambu Cloth. 
Your pledge is helping us to get Bambu into production faster. 
With that said, there are always unforeseen events that can happen, especially when dealing with a factory that’s half a world away. We wouldn’t bring this to Kickstarter if we weren’t completely confident that we could get our project delivered to backers on schedule.

Please don't hesitate to contact us anytime if you have any questions.

story:
BACKGROUND:     (Bali, Indonesia)  In 2011, plans for a shark cage activity failed due to unsustainable fishing practices.  The location became continually poached and an idea to build a sharks rescue center was created.

With no grants or financial backing the World's 1st Shark rescue nursery was founded.  The program educated nearshore fishing communities and offered alternative solutions to killing by-catch.  Fishermen were hired away from the ocean depletion equation by becoming care takers, boat drivers & guides in Eco-tourism.  It was the first time they had been given the choice not to kill all catch for an alternative lifestyle.

THE SAME FISHERMEN THAT USED TO KILL SHARKS ARE NOW SAVING THEM!

RESCUE STRATEGIES:     Sharks doomed for consumer markets are intercepted and relocated into Marine Protected Areas (MPAs.)  Rescues include but are not limited to sharks that have been saved from netting, long lines, fishing boats, fish markets, restaurants, fish tanks, and even bar aquariums.  Our rescue, rehab, transfer, and release protocols achieve survival rates in the high 90% opposed to the aquarium trade with a mortality rate above 50%.

Captured Bamboo Cat Shark stories, finned alive vs. released alive.

White Tip released on World Ocean's Day into protected waters.

 

Help raise $2,145 and save more sharks!

After five years of wear and tear, the original nursery succumbed to rotted wood, rusted nails, broken bamboo, shredded netting leaving it less then functional and unsafe.   The Black Tip pen recently broke apart and the White Tip pen has begun to sink.  Replacing the old facility with longer lasting materials makes sense opposed to trying to maintain the older structure.

NEW & IMPROVED!:  The main products sourced are Geo-Grid and a product called Floaton.  A minimum 5 pen design allows more rescues and rotations according to species, sizes, ages, condition and behavior.  More stable material will create a "floating classroom" suitable for scientist, schools, orphanages,  and groups to continue educational and research opportunities.

A 5 pens strategy optimize shark rescue & rotation opportunity

Pens separate species to avoid dominance issues

 

Stage 1 funding*

 Geo-Grid, replaces the easy to shred nylon netting and represents stage 1 of nursery.

STAGE 1 BUDGET & GOAL:  Implement Geogrid
2 rolls                        =  $ 1,200
Power Washer        =  $    250
Generator                =   $    250
64 mtr. liner            =   $    192
Gloves, rope, etc.   =   $    90
5% listing fee           =   $   99
3% commerce fee  =   $   64
   TOTAL GOAL   =   $2,145

*Once $1200 is committed, GeoGrid will be immediately ordered to continue rescues.
**Any amount above Stage 1 goal will be rolled towards Stage 2. (notes below)

 

FOUNDERS:   Hawaii's Paul Friese and Bali Fisherman Wayan Jalan teamed up to produce the simple yet effective Shark Rescue Program.  While working with sharks they have several scientific findings as the dominance between & within species.  They have been able to improve and outline protocols that not only benefit Bali's fishing practices but shark researchers around the world.  Combined they have achieved a World Record 260+ shark rescues and with 64 sharks released into Gili Trawagan's coral propagation area are noted for achieving first successful marine trophic cascade reversal.  The Rescue Center is an open source for qualified participants.

Shark Center teams with Green School in 4th floor Aquarium Bar rescue

Bali Shark Rescue Center's achievements:

- World Record Shark Rescues  (200+)
- World Record Shark Releases  (175+)
- 1st successful marine trophic cascade reversal  (Gili Trawangan)
- 1st to document sharks morphing into stripes (Cat Sharks camouflaging - twice!)
- 1st to determine dominance between Reef Tip Shark Species
- Co-Founded Bali Mammal Rescue Response
- Successful social media campaign influencing Garuda Airlines Shark Fin ban
- Successful socio-economic solution to near shore fishing by-catch waste
- multiple others

Release proves social behavior among Black Tip Reef Sharks
 

Stage 2 Funding - $36,000 goal

Replacing woods, barrels, and bamboo with prefabricated HDPE (high density poly-ethylene) modules create the framework.   Sectionals measuring a square meter and attached with fasteners can be accumulated & expandable as financing permits.  Combined with a more rigid geogrid solution should increase the usage of the rescue center to beyond 15 years.  The new setup can be trash skirted with a smaller mesh to maximize visibility and water quality.   Sharks would continue to be saved & released into MPAs (Marine Protected Areas,) namely the Gili Island's off Lombok and Nusa Penida off Bali.  Since the model is the first viable success of its kind among conservation NGO's, longevity is now the focus advancing materials. 

Stage 2 funding will also consist of grants if they become available.

Floaton, fasteners, bumpers,  $300 per sqm.@ 115 units  =   $34,500
                                                                                              shipping =   $   1,500
  4 Moorings
  Shack
  Gloves, rope, tools etc.
  stairs / ladder / boat

story:
Who am i?

My name is Esthi Zipori, i am originally from Israel, currently living in Newark, NJ.  I am a senior in the Architectural program at New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT).

This past year i began an exploration under the umbrella of Social Science and Design into the world of a city WITHOUT the private car. For me, going into Architecture was so i could change the world, and i think i found the way i would like to do it.

I received a research grant from NJIT to continue my research during the summer of 2013. The research (that i am currently conducting) is titled Prepering for Postautomonilty: Identifiying Car-Free Spaces and the Adaptive Reuse of Automotive Infrastructure. (http://postautomobility.wordpress.com/) This is the first step of what I hope to become one day a policy design maker in the real world.

I have been accepted to present this research (once concluded) in the Global Conference on Mobility Futures, held in the Center of Mobility in Lancaster University (UK) this coming September.

I need $1700 to be able to get there, which includes the flight as well as food and transportation.

Any donation will help and will be used for the purposes stated above only.  

More about the Project

With the concern of global climate change and public health cities are pursuing planning strategies to downgrade the centrality of the personal automobile while encouraging other forms of transportation; mainly walking and cycling.

The paper refers to three existing examples - the Old city of Jerusalem, Copenhagen and Masdar. Through this examples the paper intendeds to show the need of a systematic change outlining what works and what does not work in the current at large policy.

The CeMoRe ; the Center for MOBILITIES RESEARCH in Lancaster, UK “encompasses the analysis of the global, national and local movements of people, objects, capital, information and material things combining together to engender the economic and social patterning of life”* .

The conference itself called “Future Mobilities” is a celebration of the tenth anniversary of the CeMoRe “Over the past ten years the work of CeMoRe and others have helped to ‘mobilise’ the social and huan sciences and developed innovative analyses of economic, social, technological, political, policy and design transformation”*

The conference will provide a forum for the “presentation of cutting edge research from across the social sciences that reflects back on, explores the present and looks towards future mobility”

under the call for papers for the conference, me and Dr. Maurie Cohen from NJIT submitted our research into the future of automobility and were invited to present it.

The research will not end with this conference, this is merely a step but a tremendous one.

The perks

With this particular project the perks will take a while. But, maybe in twenty years or so when you live in a city that is cleaner, healthier, safer and yours (and not the cars) you will remember this project.

Until then to say thank you for your help, for any donation above 100$ i will send an original piece (i am a part time artist). 

If you can’t donate, that is ok. Pass it on and Share instead!Thank you for your consideration!


*http://www.lancs.ac.uk/fass/events/mobility-futures/index.htm

More about the Project 
With the concern of global climate change and public health cities are pursuing planning strategies to downgrade the centrality of the personal automobile while encouraging other forms of transportation; mainly walking and cycling.
The paper refers to three existing examples - the Old city of Jerusalem, Copenhagen and Masdar. Through this examples the paper intendeds to show the need of a systematic change outlining what works and what does not work in the current at large policy.
The CeMoRe ; the Center for MOBILITIES RESEARCH in Lancaster, UK “encompasses the analysis of the global, national and local movements of people, objects, capital, information and material things combining together to engender the economic and social patterning of life”* .
The conference itself called “Future Mobilities” is a celebration of the tenth anniversary of the CeMoRe “Over the past ten years the work of CeMoRe and others have helped to ‘mobilise’ the social and huan sciences and developed innovative analyses of economic, social, technological, political, policy and design transformation”*
The conference will provide a forum for the “presentation of cutting edge research from across the social sciences that reflects back on, explores the present and looks towards future mobility”
under the call for papers for the conference, me and Dr. Maurie Cohen from NJIT submitted our research into the future of automobility and were invited to present it.
The research will not end with this conference, this is merely a step but a tremendous one. 
The perks 
With this particular project the perks will take a while. But, maybe in twenty years or so when you live in a city that is cleaner, healthier, safer and yours (and not the cars) you will remember this project. 
Until then to say thank you for your help, for any donation above 100$ i will send an original piece (i am a part time artist). 
If you can’t donate, that is ok. Pass it on and Share instead!Thank you for your consideration!
*http://www.lancs.ac.uk/fass/events/mobility-futures/index.htm

story:
Hi, my name is Rob Simkins...

I'm a Year 2 student at University of Wales, Trinity St David in Carmarthen and I study Outdoor Education.  As part of our second year, we are required to run an expedition in the UK on an entirely self sufficient basis but do not get any substantial support from the establishment we pay £7500 a year to!  I want to run the best expedition this uni has ever seen in one of the iconic parts of our contry - Snowdonia National Park.  I want to prove to our uni that the sky's the limit and that as students we're able to be innovative and creative beyond the ordinary!

What We Need

I need funding for fuel costs to Snowdonia from Carmarthen, West Wales.  I also need to buy bits of equipment such as bouldering crash pads, food and maps for the expedition.  I had worked this out as being around £350, but with indiegogo putting a minimum of £500 I will invest the extra money in either renting a van to use for the duration of the expedition, or putting it toward better quality safety equipment.

If we don't meet the full £500 then I intend to use whatever we have made to put toward fuel costs, expedition food and equipment for the group!

The Impact

I'm one of the thousands of students nowadays who is paying well over the odds for my education, all of us are being left short changed by a system that isn't fair, and does not provide value for the vast amounts of money the taxpayer is paying now, and we will have to pay later in our lives.  The changing nature of my chosen course means that our year is the first year to have transport support withdrawn from this module which severely limits the range of activity and areas we can access in order to make this once in a lifetime chance a memorable one.  

For me, this £500 provides an amazing experience for myself, the participants on my expedition and also a point of guidance for other students doing our course, that if you put your mind to it, you can do amazing things!  That we are able to have an amazing experience in an amazing location against all the odds and take away a set of life skills from the planning process and execution of our expedition.  It also means that I will have had a completely original and unique approach to this module, which is something I can carry forward into my marking criteria and help me with my degree!

Risks & Challenges

In terms of risks - of course there is an element of risk in mountaineering, but that's what adventure is all about!  Identifying the risks and working to overcome them, which is down to my planning and ability as expedition leader - and I am 110% confident that I am capable of doing so.

Otherwise, it's just a case of marketing my expedition to my peers, which is something that does not worry me!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute then I understand and empathise completely! However, you may be able to help us in other ways...

We need:

  • Expedition food (wet, boil in the bag kind of stuff) for up to six people for four days.
  • Bouldering Mats x 3.
  • Rental van (potentially) for the four days!

story:
The Energy East Pipeline - What Have We Got To Lose?

Biologist Dr Frederick W. Schueler and his artist wife Aleta Karstad are committed to finding out.

Decisions are often made by government and big industry with little consideration of the health of local communities, nature, and the environment. Evaluation of big land projects in Canada are made ignoring many classes of concern - it's as if they don't want to know what's out there. 

A proposed route for the Energy East pipeline has been flung across Canada, to transport tar sands bitumen to off-shore export from the east coast, and  Dr Schueler and Aleta Karstad are launching an independent assessment of the characteristics of the rivers and streams that the Energy East Pipeline would cross. 

Steve Courtney: “My experience with utilities is that such projects are led by engineers with limited grasp of how the physical landscape is directly linked to the biotic components. Engineers while very well trained and experts in their field tend not to look beyond their training to the bigger picture. Their focus is to get the job done, and they do this exceptionally well.”

Fred and Aleta need your help now. On  August 1st they begin their expedition through eastern Ontario, Quebec, and New Brunswick, as they locate water crossings all along the proposed route of the Energy East Pipeline toward the refineries in Saint John, noting the health and diversity of vulnerable watersheds, sketching, painting, and writing, identifying amphibians and invertebrates large and small, and searching for species at risk. 

In September they head for Alberta, and will slowly work their way eastward along the pipeline route, surveying and painting precious and beautiful rivers, waterfalls, lakes, and wetlands, all so vulnerable to spills of diluted bitumen. It's not a matter of how few spills there may be, but where and when. Fred and Aleta's work will focus national attention on exactly what we stand to lose. Your contribution is essential to their work.

Aleta paints on site, 'en plein air', capturing the essence of each place in oil-on- canvas, while Fred's general biological surveys preserve a record of what "might be lost" downstream of pipeline crossings all along the route. The number of sites to be assessed will depend on circumstances and levels of support but as a rough guide, one day in the field costs $500 all-in. We're asking you to help fund their independent surveys of 20 pipeline river-crossings.

In appreciation of your support, Fred and Aleta are offering a variety of rewards including an original oil painting of the site of your choice at the $600 level, a signed fine art print at the $200 level, or a set of six hastinote art cards of Aleta's paintings of crossing sites  at the $75 level. 

Fred and Aleta will survey as many crossings as possible, self sufficient along the route in their truck and trailer with the expeditionary methods they developed through  forty years of exploring Canada's natural history. If they fail to reach their crowd-funding goal of $9,500 for twenty full site surveys, they will still complete the expedition, but with briefer visits and fewer paintings. 

Dr Fred Schueler has found, through reviewing many Environmental Assessments done by the proponents of industrial projects, that important indicator species are often not looked for by staff biologists or hired consultants. Aquatic macroinvertebrates (mussels, Crayfish & snails), invasive Plants, and terrestrial Molluscs (landsnails & slugs) are usually neglected in site assessments for landscape-altering enterprises. Reptiles and Amphibians are often missed in official Environmental Assessments based on single visits because they can only be observed at certain seasons, and in certain weather or times of day. Base line studies at many of the waterways the pipeline would cross have already been made  by Schueler and Karstad on their previous expeditions across Canada, and each visit to a fragile crossing gives us a more complete picture of its natural community.

With this in mind, at a community meeting about the Energy East Pipeline in 2013, Fred and Aleta decided to use the  Landscape Art and Science methods they have developed and published (see their books at http://www.lulu.com/spotlight/karstad), to undertake an ecological assessment of places where the pipeline route would cross streams. They have the additional resource of Fred's database to search through more than 110,000 records for earlier observations they have made near many of the crossing sites.

By November, 2014, the proposed pipeline route from the Alberta tar sands to the Bay of Fundy will no longer be 'unknown' territory. Your support will lend a voice to the vulnerable natural communities along the route. The work of this dedicated, experienced, and highly-respected artist/biologist team will show us the unique beauties of these fragile crossings, and help us to know the names of creatures with whom we share our environment - all of whose lives will be threatened if the Energy East Pipeline project proceeds. 
Please consider making a donation; every little bit takes Fred and Aleta further along this important journey.

   "Madawaska River Crossing" -  oil painting for this project by Aleta Karstad

Fred Schueler: "There are risks. We have limited time and have to cover vast distances. The remoteness of many crossings from roads will be a challenge. However, we travel efficiently and are experienced in doing field work under time stress. We also have developed methods for quick visits (http://pinicola.ca/g2007a.htm ) , Finally we are experienced in connecting with local people - naturalists, concerned citizens, and community organizations, who are always happy to share information and help out."

Although Fred and Aleta's address is Bishops Mills, Ontario, they are at home all across Canada, exploring lakes, rivers, creeks, and wetlands, and they love to tell people about the wonders of nature that everyone sees but few understand. Their goal is to help individuals make sense of their place in the landscape on a local scale, and to help decision-makers to think about sustainability from an ecological perspective.

There are other ways you can help:

  1. Guidance to river access and support along the way will be just as much help on this project as money. You can contact Fred at bckcdb@istar.ca 
  2. If you're concerned about a place where the Energy East route crosses a water body, you can invite Fred & Aleta to visit,  collect or photograph specimens for Fred & Aleta to identify, or write your thoughts and observations as a contribution to their Vulnerable Watersheds blog http://www.vulnerablewaters.blogspot.ca
  3. Times are tough, money is tight. You can make a big difference by simply getting the word out. Please use the Indiegogo Share Tools to help make some noise about this campaign

story:
OrcaLab (www.orcalab.org; www.orca-live.net/community) is an internationally recognised land based orca research facility located on Hanson Island in British Columbia, Canada.  It began as a summer campsite in 1970.  Our purpose was to see if we could observe and learn about orcas from the shore.  Indeed we could, and began a project that is now in its 44th year.  Over the years, OrcaLab has evolved into a permanent research facility that has become known for its philosophy of learning about orcas without interfering with their lives.  Hanson Island is only accessible by boat, so a boat is essential to our operations.  At the beginning, we used a borrowed boat, then built a tiny skiff powered with a Seagull outboard engine. It got us to and from Hanson Island, but the trips were definitely risky.  After that, we used a succession of bought and borrowed boats with outboard engines in various states of repair that got us to the mid 1990s.  Then a wonderful English couple introduced by the Born Free Foundation came to visit.  After a tour of the area in our “old boat” (a flat bottomed aluminum skiff) they told us that what we needed was a real boat and offered to pay for it to be built.  The June Cove transformed our lives.  Since she was launched in 1995 we’ve been able to travel safely, even in rough seas, and transport all our supplies, equipment, assistants, visitors and film crews to and from Hanson Island easily and efficiently.  Unfortunately, over the past several years it has become increasingly difficult to keep the June Cove running, because of a succession of costly issues with the engine. This year we’ve decided to ‘bite the bullet’ and replace the old engine with a new one that will keep our project going for many years to come. The purchase cost of the engine is around $30,000, but we think the final cost, after installation etc. will be more like $35,000.  We have about half of this money, so are launching this crowd funding campaign with Indiegogo to raise the rest.  Our goal is $16,000 CAD.  Given the wide interest in our project, from Orca-live streaming of live audio and video, word of mouth, and stories that have appeared in various media, it seems an attainable goal. We will deeply appreciate any and all support that comes, and hope the rewards we are offering will bring pleasure in return.  Please write to us at orcalab@island.net if you would like to join our campaign team, or have any questions. 

Whether or not you can contribute, we hope you'll be willing to pass news of our campaign on to your circle of contacts, via social media, email etc.  

Thank you so much!

Paul & Helena

story:
Here's the Deal

Orangutans are endangered, having declined by over half in the last 60 years alone due to destructive and unsustainable human activities. Today, only an estimated 50,000 Bornean Orangutans are left in the world. This is important because these Orangutans live only on the island of Borneo and are found nowhere else on earth. Once this species is lost from Borneo they will be globally extinct forever! Without serious and immediate conservation action this possible fate could become a reality.
 
Orangutans and their habitat are in desperate need of protection from human activities that are rapidly destroying their rich rainforest ecosystems. Orangutans are directly threatened by hunting and habitat loss, logging, mining and land clearing for oil palm plantations and small-scale agriculture. Many National Park Buffer Zones, areas surrounding the park, have been designated as plantation concessions, thereby destroying important blocks of habitat for endangered and threatened species, and leaving the surrounding communities with few income alternatives to slash-and-burn agriculture and illegal logging inside the National Park.
 
But here's the problem - how can one protect something if they don't know it's in trouble? How can one help save something that is disappearing if they don't know how? Education is key to conservation. We all can learn to live more sustainably, or become educated on a global problem we never knew existed. This is true for the communities surrounding Gunung Palung National Park (where we work!) in Indonesian Borneo.
 
There is still hope for orangutans and their habitat - don't let them disappear!
 

Who We Are

Gunung Palung Orangutan Conservation Program (that's us!), known locally in Indonesia as Yayasan Palung, works on the ground, at the forefront of the battle to save this magnificent species, the orangutan, and it's habitat, while strengthening the communities and lives of the people living around Gunung Palung National Park. With over a decade of experience in developing and implementing environmental education programs for adults and children alike, we are building knowledge and capacity within communities to protect the orangutan and Gunung Palung National Park, while also strengthening the economic survival of local communities.   

 

Where Is This Happening?

Gunung Palung National Park, located in Indonesian Borneo, represents one of the most important blocks of orangutan habitat left in the world. It is home to one of the only remaining viable wild populations, with an estimated 2,500 orangutans, as well as other endangered wildlife, such as gibbons, Malayan sunbears, proboscis monkeys, pangolins, and tarsiers. The wild orangutan population outside of the park's protected area, in the two regencies of Ketapang and Kayong Utara, is roughly equal to the population inside the park itself.

 

What We Are Trying To Accomplish

We are raising money to continue our work, building on 14 years of conservation education and action through:

  • Continuing and expanding our school and youth group education programs, exposing local children from Borneo to the wonders of rainforest biodiversity in their own backyard.
  • Providing university scholarships to help build Indonesia's next conservation leaders.
  • Helping Indonesian communities obtain community rights to their forests and learn optimal forest management models.
  • Building increased knowledge on actionable steps communities can take to better protect orangutans, their landscape and develop their capacity to withstand environmental changes.
  • Producing weekly radio programs, raising awareness and calling local people to action.
  • Helping local communities develop income alternatives to cutting down the rainforest of Borneo, strengthening communities' economic capacity, while also preserving the forest for generations to come. 

By donating to GPOCP today and helping us reach our fundraising goal you will be helping to directly protect orangutans and Gunung Palung National Park, preserving incredible and endangered wildlife, and strengthening rural communities for generations to come.

Our target is $10,000, but anything and everything we receive goes directly into our invaluable work - you can contribute any amount you like.

 

What Else Can I Do?

Even if you can't contribute to GPOCP today you can still help - spread the word about our program and about orangutans to as many people as you know!

If you think you can help us and our cause in other ways please don't hesitate to contact us at yayasanpalung@gmail.com

 

Interested In Staying Updated On Our Project?

Visit:

Our website: www.savegporangutans.org

Our YP blog (in Indonesian): http://yayasanpalung.blogspot.com/

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Yayasan-Palung-Gunung-Palung-Orangutan-Conservation-Program/280961206284

Sign-up for our newsletter:

GPOCP Newsletter

 

Thank you for taking an interest in our project!

The GPOCP Team

Providing university scholarships to help build Indonesia's next conservation leaders.
Helping Indonesian communities obtain community rights to their forests and learn optimal forest management models.
Building increased knowledge on actionable steps communities can take to better protect orangutans, their landscape and develop their capacity to withstand environmental changes.
Producing weekly radio programs, raising awareness and calling local people to action.
Helping local communities develop income alternatives to cutting down the rainforest of Borneo, strengthening communities' economic capacity, while also preserving the forest for generations to come. 

By donating to GPOCP today and helping us reach our fundraising goal you will be helping to directly protect orangutans and Gunung Palung National Park, preserving incredible and endangered wildlife, and strengthening rural communities for generations to come.
Our target is $10,000, but anything and everything we receive goes directly into our invaluable work - you can contribute any amount you like.
 
What Else Can I Do?
Even if you can't contribute to GPOCP today you can still help - spread the word about our program and about orangutans to as many people as you know!
If you think you can help us and our cause in other ways please don't hesitate to contact us at yayasanpalung@gmail.com
 
Interested In Staying Updated On Our Project?
Visit:
Our website: www.savegporangutans.org
Our YP blog (in Indonesian): http://yayasanpalung.blogspot.com/
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Yayasan-Palung-Gunung-Palung-Orangutan-Conservation-Program/280961206284
Sign-up for our newsletter:
GPOCP Newsletter
 
Thank you for taking an interest in our project!
The GPOCP Team

story:
What We Are Doing, and Why

The United Planet Faith & Science Initiative (the Initiative) works to mobilize the public to act now to promote environmental sustainability. The Initiative does this by leveraging the moral authority of religious leaders and the credibility of leading scientists to raise public awareness and call for action. 

In the near future, we will hold a unique web-based meeting of eminent scientists and faith leaders, which we will edit into a powerful video. We then plan to make this video accessible to the broader community via social media and news outlets, and also hold public events of these leaders speaking.

I am Rabbi Yonatan Neril, and I founded and direct The Interfaith Center for Sustainable Development (ICSD). Since a young age I have been passionate about the future of our planet, and I believe this Initiative can do a lot to promote public awareness, political will, and action. The following are Founding Members of the Initiative, and are described below in more detail:

How Can We Promote A Livable Planet For Our Children?

“Religion and science are the two most powerful forces in the world today… If there is any moral precept shared by people of all beliefs, it is that we owe ourselves and future generations a beautiful, rich, and healthful environment.” – E.O. Wilson, The Creation: An Appeal to Save Life on Earth

Leaders in science and faith, working together, are able to appeal to vast numbers of people. Billions practice the world’s many religions. Billions respect the scientific view of the universe. Many billions hold both the spiritual and scientific views with equal respect. Science provides valuable insights into cause and effect and can help us address our ecological challenges. Religion is a channel for moral and ethical instruction and can help us to consider and act on the roots of our ecological crisis. This project will fuse these two powerful and traditionally divergent schools of thought to galvanize a conscientious shift. 

The Interfaith Center for Sustainable Development (ICSD) and The Interfaith Declaration on Climate Change are teaming up on this Initiative to bring together prominent world leaders in the science and faith communities. The Initiative promotes both institutional and grassroots changes to decrease emissions, as well as transitions to clean energy and strategies to protect natural resources. It mobilizes communities towards action based on an increased recognition of our climate and habitat problems.

Our Fundraising Goal

We aim to raise $13,000 in this campaign, which will fund staff video editing of the meeting contents, telepresence technology, coordination of the Initiative and social media promotion of the short video, and other expenses related to the United Planet Faith & Science Initiative.  If you are inspired by this Initiative, please contribute and tell your friends and family! Use the Indiegogo share tool to spread the word.

How Your Donation Will Be Spent

Who Is Involved:

The project has already secured the involvement of the following world-renowned scientists and religious leaders, who have pledged their support as Founding Members of this initiative:

Religious Figures: Archbishop Desmond Tutu, former Archbishop of Cape Town, South Africa and Nobel Peace Prize Laureate; Swami Chidananda Saraswati, President and Spiritual Head of the Parmarth Niketan Ashram (one of India's largest spiritual institutions); Rabbi David Rosen CBE, International Director of Interreligious Affairs of AJC; Rev. Canon Sally G. Bingham, President, The Regeneration Project and Interfaith Power and Light; Haj Fazlun Khalid (United Kingdom), Founder and Director of the Islamic Foundation for Ecology and Environmental Science; Baron Dr. Rowan Williams (United Kingdom), former Archbishop of Canterbury. 

Scientists: Dr. James Hansen (United States), Former Head of the NASA Goddard Institute for Space Studies (1981-2013); Dr. Rajendra Pachauri (India, United States), Chair of Nobel Peace Prize-winning Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC); Dr. Michael Oppenheimer (United States), Professor of Geosciences and International Affairs in the Woodrow Wilson School and the Department of Geosciences at Princeton University; Dr. Katherine Hayhoe (United States), Atmospheric Scientist and expert reviewer for the IPCC; Dr. Michael Mann (United States), Director of the Earth System Science Center at Pennsylvania State University.

The Initiative is being coordinated by Stuart Scott, Director of UPFSI, Dr. Joan Lurie, Coordinator of Science Outreach for UPFSI, and Rabbi Yonatan Neril.

To learn more about the United Planet Faith and Science Initiative, click here to go to the UPFSI website. Click here to see a list of all those who have already contributed!

Click here to view a larger Theory of Change diagram. 

About the organizational partners:

The Interfaith Center for Sustainable Development

The Interfaith Center for Sustainable Development (ICSD) accesses the collective wisdom of the world’s religions to promote co-existence, peace, and sustainability through education and action. Since its inception, ICSD has hosted three interfaith environmental conferences where world religious leaders spoke out about the ethical imperative and religious basis for action on environmental sustainability. Hundreds participated in these conferences, which generated press coverage in over 50 media outlets. The UPFSI extends the ‘One Home’ video campaign, an ICSD project that featured world religious leaders speaking out on environmental sustainability. Other Holy Land-based programs of ICSD include its Interfaith Women’s Ecology Project and the Interfaith Seminary Students Sustainability Project. ICSD is fiscally sponsored in the US by the Los Angeles-based 501(c)3 Jumpstart, and donations received through this campaign are processed by them and are tax-deductible in the U.S.

The Interfaith Declaration on Climate Change

The Interfaith Declaration on Climate Change (IDCC) has created a coalition of religious leaders and scientists united by a shared sense of urgency about climate change. Endorsed by spiritual and secular individuals around the world, it has held numerous press conferences at UN climate negotiations. The UN Climate Secretariat began emphasizing how faith communities can influence the negotiations after the first IDCC press event.

story:
What is CleanApp?

• CleanApp is a trash reporting app.  Trash reporting apps allow a user to snap a photo and automatically report litter/graffiti/trash to municipal litter/graffiti/trash abatement services (i.e., the Departments of Parks and Public Services within respective cities, counties, etc.).

How is CleanApp different from other trash reporting apps?

• There are a lot of trash reporting apps out there, including some that claim to be global.  There is only one open-source trash reporting app (Italy's DecoroUrbano).  There are no wiki-based global trash reporting apps.

What does it do? 

•  CleanApp is a scalable, sustainable, non-profit platform that allows us to understand just how much litter humans produce, as well as provides a platform for trash cleanup. 

How does it work? 

•  Users launch CleanApp from their smartphones or tablets, and in a one slide, one-click operation, photograph an item of litter anywhere in the world. The photo is geo-tagged and processed by the CleanApp database where it is reported to the entities responsible for trash pickup. 

• The photo report is matched to the correct responding party based on rigid open-source-generated municipal jurisdiction lines.  The CleanAppMap will be an open-source wiki, allowing users anywhere in the world to add their municipal trash abatement services to the database.  University students will be able to add map layers to identify who is responsible for trash cleanup in a respective part of a university.  Private landowners will be able to identify who is responsible for trash cleanup on their territory.  

Who it serves?  Where will it work?

• CleanApp (beta) will serve a select number of universities, followed by a live release to select global cities.  CleanApp 1.0.0 will be launched in Summer 2013 and will immediately expand to large U.S. urban clusters, contingent on crowdsources/opensourced/wiki contributions by users to the database of municipal service providers. 

• Like Facebooks's growth model, CleanApp will also expand from select clusters of large US and international universities.  As institutions that must be responsible to their students and other stakeholders, colleges have a vested interest in adopting CleanApp.

• Like Yelp, CleanApp will also provide municipalities with a free web-based and mobile dashboard that they can adopt to deal with users-generated CleanApp reports.  Currently, both SeeClickFix and App-Order provide these services on a subscription basis.

• Depending on success of early adopters and a robust open-source wiki database, CleanApp can expand to become the leading global platform for environmental activism, reporting, and nuisance tracking. 

When does it launch?

• CleanApp is raising crowdsourced capital to launch in Summer 2013. CleanApp anticipates raising $510,000 by Earth Day 2013 (April 22, 2013). Pending a successful seed stage capital campaign, CleanApp will launch the beta version of CleanApp in Summer 2013, followed by rollout to global universities, corporate campuses, and select global cities in Fall 2013.

Who are we?

• CleanApp is founded by social media entrepreneurs and progressive academics and policymakers.  CleanApp has been backed by the CleanApp is currently a project of California Solar Power, LLC, a green energy think tank founded by Boris Mamlyuk.  Upon successful beta launch, CleanApp will be staffed by managers and volunteer interns drawn from leading global universities.  Please visit our project whiteboard to learn more and to contribute.

How will the seed money be spent?

• We will spend the money on software development (App design, wiki database architecture, and database administration), graphic design, staffing, marketing, and advocacy to user communities and municipalities for a successful beta launch.  Upon the close of this successful campaign, we will apply to incorporate CleanApp as a non-profit 501(c)(3) organizaton.  Our staffing and funding model will emulate the Wikimedia Foundation, and will seek strategic partnerships with other open-source collaboratives.  We will provide detailed accounting of all expenditures on a quarterly basis.  Thank you so much for your support.  

What if I hate trash, but don't have cash?

• Pleae share this campaign, 'like' us on Facebook, contribute to our wikimap by uploading the contact info of the party responsible for litter abatement in your city, help design promotional materials, record video or audio campaign ads in different languages, publicize this as broadly as possible.  This is the very essence of an open-source campaign.  Please help.
